title: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
text: Than this of Juliet and her Romeo.

title: The Tragedy of Romeo and Juliet
text: Exeunt omnes.

text: Don John, his bastard brother.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claudio, a young lord of Florence.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Benedick, a Young lord of Padua.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leonato, Governor of Messina.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Antonio, an old man, his brother.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Balthasar, attendant on Don Pedro.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Borachio, follower of Don John.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Conrade, follower of Don John.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Friar Francis.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dogberry, a Constable.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Verges, a Headborough.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: A Sexton.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: A Boy.

title: Much Ado about Nothing

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beatrice, niece to Leonato.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Margaret, waiting gentlewoman attending on Hero.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Ursula, waiting gentlewoman attending on Hero.

text: Messengers, Watch, Attendants, etc.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: SCENE.--Messina.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: ACT I. Scene I.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: An orchard before Leonato's house.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Leonato (Governor of Messina), Hero (his Daughter), and Beatrice

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: (his Niece), with a Messenger.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. I learn in this letter that Don Pedro of Arragon comes this

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: night to Messina.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Mess. He is very near by this. He was not three leagues off when I

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: left him.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. How many gentlemen have you lost in this action?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Mess. But few of any sort, and none of name.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. A victory is twice itself when the achiever brings home full

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: numbers. I find here that Don Pedro hath bestowed much honour on

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: a young Florentine called Claudio.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Mess. Much deserv'd on his part, and equally rememb'red by Don

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. He hath borne himself beyond the promise of his age, doing

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: in the figure of a lamb the feats of a lion. He hath indeed

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: better bett'red expectation than you must expect of me to tell

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: you how.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. He hath an uncle here in Messina will be very much glad of it.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Mess. I have already delivered him letters, and there appears much

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: joy in him; even so much that joy could not show itself modest

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: enough without a badge of bitterness.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Did he break out into tears?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Mess. In great measure.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. A kind overflow of kindness. There are no faces truer than

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: those that are so wash'd. How much better is it to weep at joy

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: than to joy at weeping!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. I pray you, is Signior Mountanto return'd from the wars or no?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Mess. I know none of that name, lady. There was none such in the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: army of any sort.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. What is he that you ask for, niece?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero. My cousin means Signior Benedick of Padua.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Mess. O, he's return'd, and as pleasant as ever he was.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. He set up his bills here in Messina and challeng'd Cupid at

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the flight, and my uncle's fool, reading the challenge,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: subscrib'd for Cupid and challeng'd him at the burbolt. I pray

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: you, how many hath he kill'd and eaten in these wars? But how

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: many hath he kill'd? For indeed I promised to eat all of his

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: killing.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Faith, niece, you tax Signior Benedick too much; but he'll

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: be meet with you, I doubt it not.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Mess. He hath done good service, lady, in these wars.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. You had musty victual, and he hath holp to eat it. He is a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: very valiant trencherman; he hath an excellent stomach.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Mess. And a good soldier too, lady.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. And a good soldier to a lady; but what is he to a lord?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Mess. A lord to a lord, a man to a man; stuff'd with all honourable

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: virtues.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. It is so indeed. He is no less than a stuff'd man; but for

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the stuffing--well, we are all mortal.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. You must not, sir, mistake my niece. There is a kind of merry

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: war betwixt Signior Benedick and her. They never meet but there's

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: a skirmish of wit between them.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Alas, he gets nothing by that! In our last conflict four of

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: his five wits went halting off, and now is the whole man govern'd

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: with one; so that if he have wit enough to keep himself warm, let

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: him bear it for a difference between himself and his horse; for

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: it is all the wealth that he hath left to be known a reasonable

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: creature. Who is his companion now? He hath every month a new

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: sworn brother.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Mess. Is't possible?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Very easily possible. He wears his faith but as the fashion

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: of his hat; it ever changes with the next block.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Mess. I see, lady, the gentleman is not in your books.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. No. An he were, I would burn my study. But I pray you, who is

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: his companion? Is there no young squarer now that will make a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: voyage with him to the devil?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Mess. He is most in the company of the right noble Claudio.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. O Lord, he will hang upon him like a disease! He is sooner

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: caught than the pestilence, and the taker runs presently mad.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: God help the noble Claudio! If he have caught the Benedick, it will

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: cost him a thousand pound ere 'a be cured.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Mess. I will hold friends with you, lady.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Do, good friend.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. You will never run mad, niece.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. No, not till a hot January.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Mess. Don Pedro is approach'd.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Don Pedro, Claudio, Benedick, Balthasar, and John the Bastard.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Good Signior Leonato, are you come to meet your trouble? The

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: fashion of the world is to avoid cost, and you encounter it.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Never came trouble to my house in the likeness of your Grace;

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: for trouble being gone, comfort should remain; but when you depart

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: from me, sorrow abides and happiness takes his leave.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. You embrace your charge too willingly. I think this is your

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: daughter.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Her mother hath many times told me so.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Were you in doubt, sir, that you ask'd her?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Signior Benedick, no; for then were you a child.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. You have it full, Benedick. We may guess by this what you

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: are, being a man. Truly the lady fathers herself. Be happy, lady;

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: for you are like an honourable father.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. If Signior Leonato be her father, she would not have his head

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: on her shoulders for all Messina, as like him as she is.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. I wonder that you will still be talking, Signior Benedick.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Nobody marks you.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. What, my dear Lady Disdain! are you yet living?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Is it possible Disdain should die while she hath such meet

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: food to feed it as Signior Benedick? Courtesy itself must convert

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: to disdain if you come in her presence.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Then is courtesy a turncoat. But it is certain I am loved of

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: all ladies, only you excepted; and I would I could find in my

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: heart that I had not a hard heart, for truly I love none.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. A dear happiness to women! They would else have been troubled

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: with a pernicious suitor. I thank God and my cold blood, I am of

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: your humour for that. I had rather hear my dog bark at a crow

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: than a man swear he loves me.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. God keep your ladyship still in that mind! So some gentleman

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: or other shall scape a predestinate scratch'd face.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Scratching could not make it worse an 'twere such a face as

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: yours were.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Well, you are a rare parrot-teacher.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. A bird of my tongue is better than a beast of yours.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. I would my horse had the speed of your tongue, and so good a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: continuer. But keep your way, a God's name! I have done.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. You always end with a jade's trick. I know you of old.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. That is the sum of all, Leonato. Signior Claudio and Signior

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Benedick, my dear friend Leonato hath invited you all. I tell him

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: we shall stay here at the least a month, and he heartly prays

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: some occasion may detain us longer. I dare swear he is no

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: hypocrite, but prays from his heart.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. If you swear, my lord, you shall not be forsworn. [To Don

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John] Let me bid you welcome, my lord. Being reconciled to the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Prince your brother, I owe you all duty.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. I thank you. I am not of many words, but I thank you.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Please it your Grace lead on?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Your hand, Leonato. We will go together.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Exeunt. Manent Benedick and Claudio.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Benedick, didst thou note the daughter of Signior Leonato?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. I noted her not, but I look'd on her.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Is she not a modest young lady?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Do you question me, as an honest man should do, for my simple

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: true judgment? or would you have me speak after my custom, as

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: being a professed tyrant to their sex?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. No. I pray thee speak in sober judgment.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Why, i' faith, methinks she's too low for a high praise,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: too brown for a fair praise, and too little for a great praise.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Only this commendation I can afford her, that were she other

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: than she is, she were unhandsome, and being no other but as she

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: is, I do not like her.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Thou thinkest I am in sport. I pray thee tell me truly how

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: thou lik'st her.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Would you buy her, that you enquire after her?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Can the world buy such a jewel?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Yea, and a case to put it into. But speak you this with a sad

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: brow? or do you play the flouting Jack, to tell us Cupid is a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: good hare-finder and Vulcan a rare carpenter? Come, in what key

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: shall a man take you to go in the song?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. In mine eye she is the sweetest lady that ever I look'd on.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. I can see yet without spectacles, and I see no such matter.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: There's her cousin, an she were not possess'd with a fury,exceeds

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: her as much in beauty as the first of May doth the last of

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: December. But I hope you have no intent to turn husband, have

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: you?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. I would scarce trust myself, though I had sworn the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: contrary, if Hero would be my wife.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Is't come to this? In faith, hath not the world one man but

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: he will wear his cap with suspicion? Shall I never see a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: bachelor of threescore again? Go to, i' faith! An thou wilt needs

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: thrust thy neck into a yoke, wear the print of it and sigh away

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Sundays.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Don Pedro.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Look! Don Pedro is returned to seek you.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. What secret hath held you here, that you followed not to

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leonato's?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. I would your Grace would constrain me to tell.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. I charge thee on thy allegiance.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. You hear, Count Claudio. I can be secret as a dumb man, I

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: would have you think so; but, on my allegiance--mark you this-on

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: my allegiance! he is in love. With who? Now that is your Grace's

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: part. Mark how short his answer is: With Hero, Leonato's short

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: daughter.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. If this were so, so were it utt'red.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Like the old tale, my lord: 'It is not so, nor 'twas not so;

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: but indeed, God forbid it should be so!'

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. If my passion change not shortly, God forbid it should be

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: otherwise.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Amen, if you love her; for the lady is very well worthy.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. You speak this to fetch me in, my lord.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. By my troth, I speak my thought.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. And, in faith, my lord, I spoke mine.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. And, by my two faiths and troths, my lord, I spoke mine.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. That I love her, I feel.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. That she is worthy, I know.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. That I neither feel how she should be loved, nor know how she

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: should be worthy, is the opinion that fire cannot melt out of me.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I will die in it at the stake.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Thou wast ever an obstinate heretic in the despite of

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: beauty.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. And never could maintain his part but in the force of his

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: will.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. That a woman conceived me, I thank her; that she brought me

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: up, I likewise give her most humble thanks; but that I will have

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: a rechate winded in my forehead, or hang my bugle in an invisible

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: baldrick, all women shall pardon me. Because I will not do them

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the wrong to mistrust any, I will do myself the right to trust

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: none; and the fine is (for the which I may go the finer), I will

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: live a bachelor.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. I shall see thee, ere I die, look pale with love.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. With anger, with sickness, or with hunger, my lord; not with

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: love. Prove that ever I lose more blood with love than I will get

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: again with drinking, pick out mine eyes with a ballad-maker's pen

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: and hang me up at the door of a brothel house for the sign of

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: blind Cupid.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Well, if ever thou dost fall from this faith, thou wilt

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: prove a notable argument.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. If I do, hang me in a bottle like a cat and shoot at me; and

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: he that hits me, let him be clapp'd on the shoulder and call'd

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Adam.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Well, as time shall try.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 'In time the savage bull doth bear the yoke.'

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. The savage bull may; but if ever the sensible Benedick bear

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: it, pluck off the bull's horns and set them in my forehead, and

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: let me be vilely painted, and in such great letters as they write

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 'Here is good horse to hire,' let them signify under my sign

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 'Here you may see Benedick the married man.'

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. If this should ever happen, thou wouldst be horn-mad.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Nay, if Cupid have not spent all his quiver in Venice, thou

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: wilt quake for this shortly.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. I look for an earthquake too then.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Well, you will temporize with the hours. In the meantime,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: good Signior Benedick, repair to Leonato's, commend me to him and

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: tell him I will not fail him at supper; for indeed he hath made

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: great preparation.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. I have almost matter enough in me for such an embassage; and

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: so I commit you--

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. To the tuition of God. From my house--if I had it--

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. The sixth of July. Your loving friend, Benedick.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Nay, mock not, mock not. The body of your discourse is

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: sometime guarded with fragments, and the guards are but slightly

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: basted on neither. Ere you flout old ends any further, examine

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: your conscience. And so I leave you.                   Exit.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. My liege, your Highness now may do me good.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. My love is thine to teach. Teach it but how,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And thou shalt see how apt it is to learn

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Any hard lesson that may do thee good.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Hath Leonato any son, my lord?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. No child but Hero; she's his only heir.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dost thou affect her, Claudio?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud.O my lord,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: When you went onward on this ended action,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I look'd upon her with a soldier's eye,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: That lik'd, but had a rougher task in hand

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Than to drive liking to the name of love;

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: But now I am return'd and that war-thoughts

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Have left their places vacant, in their rooms

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Come thronging soft and delicate desires,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: All prompting me how fair young Hero is,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Saying I lik'd her ere I went to wars.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Thou wilt be like a lover presently

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And tire the hearer with a book of words.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: If thou dost love fair Hero, cherish it,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And I will break with her and with her father,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And thou shalt have her. Wast not to this end

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: That thou began'st to twist so fine a story?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. How sweetly you do minister to love,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: That know love's grief by his complexion!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: But lest my liking might too sudden seem,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I would have salv'd it with a longer treatise.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. What need the bridge much broader than the flood?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: The fairest grant is the necessity.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Look, what will serve is fit. 'Tis once, thou lovest,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And I will fit thee with the remedy.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I know we shall have revelling to-night.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I will assume thy part in some disguise

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And tell fair Hero I am Claudio,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And in her bosom I'll unclasp my heart

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And take her hearing prisoner with the force

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And strong encounter of my amorous tale.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Then after to her father will I break,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And the conclusion is, she shall be thine.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: In practice let us put it presently.                 Exeunt.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Scene II.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: A room in Leonato's house.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter [at one door] Leonato and [at another door, Antonio] an old man,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: brother to Leonato.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. How now, brother? Where is my cousin your son? Hath he

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: provided this music?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Ant. He is very busy about it. But, brother, I can tell you strange

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: news that you yet dreamt not of.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Are they good?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Ant. As the event stamps them; but they have a good cover, they

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: show well outward. The Prince and Count Claudio, walking in a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: thick-pleached alley in mine orchard, were thus much overheard by

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: a man of mine: the Prince discovered to Claudio that he loved my

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: niece your daughter and meant to acknowledge it this night in a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: dance, and if he found her accordant, he meant to take the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: present time by the top and instantly break with you of it.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Hath the fellow any wit that told you this?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Ant. A good sharp fellow. I will send for him, and question him

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: yourself.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. No, no. We will hold it as a dream till it appear itself; but

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I will acquaint my daughter withal, that she may be the better

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: prepared for an answer, if peradventure this be true. Go you and

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: tell her of it.                              [Exit Antonio.]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: [Enter Antonio's Son with a Musician, and others.]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: [To the Son] Cousin, you know what you have to do.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: --[To the Musician] O, I cry you mercy, friend. Go you with me,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: and I will use your skill.--Good cousin, have a care this busy

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: time.                                                Exeunt.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Scene III.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Another room in Leonato's house.]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Sir John the Bastard and Conrade, his companion.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. What the goodyear, my lord! Why are you thus out of measure

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: sad?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. There is no measure in the occasion that breeds; therefore

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the sadness is without limit.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. You should hear reason.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. And when I have heard it, what blessings brings it?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. If not a present remedy, at least a patient sufferance.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. I wonder that thou (being, as thou say'st thou art, born

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: under Saturn) goest about to apply a moral medicine to a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: mortifying mischief. I cannot hide what I am: I must be sad when

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I have cause, and smile at no man's jests; eat when I have

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: stomach, and wait for no man's leisure; sleep when I am drowsy,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: and tend on no man's business; laugh when I am merry, and claw no

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: man in his humour.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. Yea, but you must not make the full show of this till you may

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: do it without controlment. You have of late stood out against

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: your brother, and he hath ta'en you newly into his grace, where

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: it is impossible you should take true root but by the fair

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: weather that you make yourself. It is needful that you frame the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: season for your own harvest.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. I had rather be a canker in a hedge than a rose in his grace,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: and it better fits my blood to be disdain'd of all than to

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: fashion a carriage to rob love from any. In this, though I cannot

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: be said to be a flattering honest man, it must not be denied but

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I am a plain-dealing villain. I am trusted with a muzzle and

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: enfranchis'd with a clog; therefore I have decreed not to sing in

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: my cage. If I had my mouth, I would bite; if I had my liberty, I

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: would do my liking. In the meantime let me be that I am, and seek

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: not to alter me.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. Can you make no use of your discontent?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. I make all use of it, for I use it only.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Borachio.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Who comes here? What news, Borachio?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. I came yonder from a great supper. The Prince your brother is

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: royally entertain'd by Leonato, and I can give you intelligence

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: of an intended marriage.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. Will it serve for any model to build mischief on?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: What is he for a fool that betroths himself to unquietness?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Marry, it is your brother's right hand.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. Who? the most exquisite Claudio?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Even he.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. A proper squire! And who? and who? which way looks he?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Marry, on Hero, the daughter and heir of Leonato.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. A very forward March-chick! How came you to this?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Being entertain'd for a perfumer, as I was smoking a musty

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: room, comes me the Prince and Claudio, hand in hand in sad

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: conference. I whipt me behind the arras and there heard it agreed

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: upon that the Prince should woo Hero for himself, and having

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: obtain'd her, give her to Count Claudio.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. Come, come, let us thither. This may prove food to my

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: displeasure. That young start-up hath all the glory of my

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: overthrow. If I can cross him any way, I bless myself every way.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: You are both sure, and will assist me?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. To the death, my lord.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. Let us to the great supper. Their cheer is the greater that

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I am subdued. Would the cook were o' my mind! Shall we go prove

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: what's to be done?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. We'll wait upon your lordship.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Exeunt.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: ACT II. Scene I.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: A hall in Leonato's house.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Leonato, [Antonio] his Brother, Hero his Daughter, and Beatrice

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: his Niece, and a Kinsman; [also Margaret and Ursula].

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Was not Count John here at supper?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Ant. I saw him not.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. How tartly that gentleman looks! I never can see him but I am

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: heart-burn'd an hour after.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero. He is of a very melancholy disposition.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. He were an excellent man that were made just in the midway

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: between him and Benedick. The one is too like an image and says

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: nothing, and the other too like my lady's eldest son, evermore

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: tattling.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Then half Signior Benedick's tongue in Count John's mouth,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: and half Count John's melancholy in Signior Benedick's face--

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. With a good leg and a good foot, uncle, and money enough in

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: his purse, such a man would win any woman in the world--if 'a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: could get her good will.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. By my troth, niece, thou wilt never get thee a husband if

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: thou be so shrewd of thy tongue.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Ant. In faith, she's too curst.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Too curst is more than curst. I shall lessen God's sending

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: that way, for it is said, 'God sends a curst cow short horns,'

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: but to a cow too curst he sends none.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. So, by being too curst, God will send you no horns.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Just, if he send me no husband; for the which blessing I am

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: at him upon my knees every morning and evening. Lord, I could not

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: endure a husband with a beard on his face. I had rather lie in

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the woollen!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. You may light on a husband that hath no beard.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. What should I do with him? dress him in my apparel and make

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: him my waiting gentlewoman? He that hath a beard is more than a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: youth, and he that hath no beard is less than a man; and he that

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: is more than a youth is not for me; and he that is less than a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: man, I am not for him. Therefore I will even take sixpence in

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: earnest of the berrord and lead his apes into hell.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Well then, go you into hell?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. No; but to the gate, and there will the devil meet me like an

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: old cuckold with horns on his head, and say 'Get you to heaven,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beatrice, get you to heaven. Here's no place for you maids.' So

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: deliver I up my apes, and away to Saint Peter--for the heavens.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: He shows me where the bachelors sit, and there live we as merry

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: as the day is long.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Ant. [to Hero] Well, niece, I trust you will be rul'd by your

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: father.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Yes faith. It is my cousin's duty to make cursy and say,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 'Father, as it please you.' But yet for all that, cousin, let him

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: be a handsome fellow, or else make another cursy, and say,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 'Father, as it please me.'

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Well, niece, I hope to see you one day fitted with a husband.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Not till God make men of some other metal than earth. Would

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: it not grieve a woman to be overmaster'd with a piece of valiant

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: dust? to make an account of her life to a clod of wayward marl?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: No, uncle, I'll none. Adam's sons are my brethren, and truly I

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: hold it a sin to match in my kinred.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Daughter, remember what I told you. If the Prince do solicit

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: you in that kind, you know your answer.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. The fault will be in the music, cousin, if you be not wooed

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: in good time. If the Prince be too important, tell him there is

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: measure in everything, and so dance out the answer. For, hear me,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero: wooing, wedding, and repenting is as a Scotch jig, a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: measure, and a cinque-pace: the first suit is hot and hasty like

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: a Scotch jig--and full as fantastical; the wedding, mannerly

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: modest, as a measure, full of state and ancientry; and then comes

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Repentance and with his bad legs falls into the cinque-pace

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: faster and faster, till he sink into his grave.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Cousin, you apprehend passing shrewdly.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. I have a good eye, uncle; I can see a church by daylight.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. The revellers are ent'ring, brother. Make good room.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: [Exit Antonio.]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter, [masked,] Don Pedro, Claudio, Benedick, and Balthasar.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: [With them enter Antonio, also masked. After them enter]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Don John [and Borachio (without masks), who stand aside

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: and look on during the dance].

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Lady, will you walk a bout with your friend?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero. So you walk softly and look sweetly and say nothing,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I am yours for the walk; and especially when I walk away.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. With me in your company?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero. I may say so when I please.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. And when please you to say so?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero. When I like your favour, for God defend the lute should be

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: like the case!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. My visor is Philemon's roof; within the house is Jove.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero. Why then, your visor should be thatch'd.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Speak low if you speak love.         [Takes her aside.]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Balth. Well, I would you did like me.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. So would not I for your own sake, for I have many ill

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: qualities.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Balth. Which is one?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. I say my prayers aloud.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Balth. I love you the better. The hearers may cry Amen.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. God match me with a good dancer!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Balth. Amen.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. And God keep him out of my sight when the dance is done!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Answer, clerk.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Balth. No more words. The clerk is answered.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: [Takes her aside.]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Urs. I know you well enough. You are Signior Antonio.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Ant. At a word, I am not.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Urs. I know you by the waggling of your head.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Ant. To tell you true, I counterfeit him.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Urs. You could never do him so ill-well unless you were the very

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: man. Here's his dry hand up and down. You are he, you are he!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Ant. At a word, I am not.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Urs. Come, come, do you think I do not know you by your excellent

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: wit? Can virtue hide itself? Go to, mum you are he. Graces will

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: appear, and there's an end.              [ They step aside.]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Will you not tell me who told you so?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. No, you shall pardon me.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Nor will you not tell me who you are?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Not now.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. That I was disdainful, and that I had my good wit out of the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 'Hundred Merry Tales.' Well, this was Signior Benedick that said

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: so.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. What's he?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. I am sure you know him well enough.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Not I, believe me.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Did he never make you laugh?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. I pray you, what is he?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Why, he is the Prince's jester, a very dull fool. Only his

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: gift is in devising impossible slanders. None but libertines

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: delight in him; and the commendation is not in his wit, but in

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: his villany; for he both pleases men and angers them, and then

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: they laugh at him and beat him. I am sure he is in the fleet.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I would he had boarded me.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. When I know the gentleman, I'll tell him what you say.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Do, do. He'll but break a comparison or two on me; which

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: peradventure, not marked or not laugh'd at, strikes him into

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: melancholy; and then there's a partridge wing saved, for the fool

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: will eat no supper that night.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: [Music.]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: We must follow the leaders.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. In every good thing.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Nay, if they lead to any ill, I will leave them at the next

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: turning.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dance. Exeunt (all but Don John, Borachio, and Claudio].

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. Sure my brother is amorous on Hero and hath withdrawn her

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: father to break with him about it. The ladies follow her and but

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: one visor remains.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. And that is Claudio. I know him by his bearing.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. Are you not Signior Benedick?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. You know me well. I am he.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. Signior, you are very near my brother in his love. He is

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: enamour'd on Hero. I pray you dissuade him from her; she is no

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: equal for his birth. You may do the part of an honest man in it.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. How know you he loves her?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. I heard him swear his affection.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. So did I too, and he swore he would marry her tonight.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. Come, let us to the banquet.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Exeunt. Manet Claudio.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Thus answer I in name of Benedick

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: But hear these ill news with the ears of Claudio.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: [Unmasks.]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 'Tis certain so. The Prince wooes for himself.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Friendship is constant in all other things

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Save in the office and affairs of love.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Therefore all hearts in love use their own tongues;

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Let every eye negotiate for itself

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And trust no agent; for beauty is a witch

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Against whose charms faith melteth into blood.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: This is an accident of hourly proof,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Which I mistrusted not. Farewell therefore Hero!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Benedick [unmasked].

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Count Claudio?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Yea, the same.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Come, will you go with me?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Whither?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Even to the next willow, about your own business, County. What

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: fashion will you wear the garland of? about your neck, like an

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: usurer's chain? or under your arm, like a lieutenant's scarf? You

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: must wear it one way, for the Prince hath got your Hero.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. I wish him joy of her.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Why, that's spoken like an honest drovier. So they sell

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: bullocks. But did you think the Prince would have served you

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: thus?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. I pray you leave me.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Ho! now you strike like the blind man! 'Twas the boy that

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: stole your meat, and you'll beat the post.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. If it will not be, I'll leave you.                Exit.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Alas, poor hurt fowl! now will he creep into sedges. But,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: that my Lady Beatrice should know me, and not know me! The

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Prince's fool! Ha! it may be I go under that title because I am

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: merry. Yea, but so I am apt to do myself wrong. I am not so

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: reputed. It is the base (though bitter) disposition of Beatrice

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: that puts the world into her person and so gives me out. Well,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I'll be revenged as I may.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Don Pedro.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Now, signior, where's the Count? Did you see him?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Troth, my lord, I have played the part of Lady Fame, I found

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: him here as melancholy as a lodge in a warren. I told him, and I

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: think I told him true, that your Grace had got the good will of

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: this young lady, and I off'red him my company to a willow tree,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: either to make him a garland, as being forsaken, or to bind him

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: up a rod, as being worthy to be whipt.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. To be whipt? What's his fault?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. The flat transgression of a schoolboy who, being overjoyed

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: with finding a bird's nest, shows it his companion, and he steals

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: it.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Wilt thou make a trust a transgression? The transgression is

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: in the stealer.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Yet it had not been amiss the rod had been made, and the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: garland too; for the garland he might have worn himself, and the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: rod he might have bestowed on you, who, as I take it, have stol'n

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: his bird's nest.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. I will but teach them to sing and restore them to the owner.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. If their singing answer your saying, by my faith you say

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: honestly.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. The Lady Beatrice hath a quarrel to you. The gentleman that

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: danc'd with her told her she is much wrong'd by you.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. O, she misus'd me past the endurance of a block! An oak but

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: with one green leaf on it would have answered her; my very visor

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: began to assume life and scold with her. She told me, not

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: thinking I had been myself, that I was the Prince's jester, that

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I was duller than a great thaw; huddling jest upon jest with such

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: impossible conveyance upon me that I stood like a man at a mark,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: with a whole army shooting at me. She speaks poniards, and every

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: word stabs. If her breath were as terrible as her terminations,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: there were no living near her; she would infect to the North

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Star. I would not marry her though she were endowed with all that

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Adam had left him before he transgress'd. She would have made

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hercules have turn'd spit, yea, and have cleft his club to make

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the fire too. Come, talk not of her. You shall find her the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: infernal Ate in good apparel. I would to God some scholar would

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: conjure her, for certainly, while she is here, a man may live as

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: quiet in hell as in a sanctuary; and people sin upon purpose,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: because they would go thither; so indeed all disquiet, horror,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: and perturbation follows her.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Claudio and Beatrice, Leonato, Hero.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Look, here she comes.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Will your Grace command me any service to the world's end? I

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: will go on the slightest errand now to the Antipodes that you can

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: devise to send me on; I will fetch you a toothpicker now from the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: furthest inch of Asia; bring you the length of Prester John's

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: foot; fetch you a hair off the great Cham's beard; do you any

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: embassage to the Pygmies--rather than hold three words'

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: conference with this harpy. You have no employment for me?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. None, but to desire your good company.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. O God, sir, here's a dish I love not! I cannot endure my Lady

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Tongue.                                              [Exit.]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Come, lady, come; you have lost the heart of Signior

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Benedick.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Indeed, my lord, he lent it me awhile, and I gave him use for

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: it--a double heart for his single one. Marry, once before he won

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: it of me with false dice; therefore your Grace may well say I

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: have lost it.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. You have put him down, lady; you have put him down.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. So I would not he should do me, my lord, lest I should prove

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the mother of fools. I have brought Count Claudio, whom you sent

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: me to seek.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Why, how now, Count? Wherefore are you sad?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Not sad, my lord.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. How then? sick?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Neither, my lord.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. The Count is neither sad, nor sick, nor merry, nor well; but

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: civil count--civil as an orange, and something of that jealous

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: complexion.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. I' faith, lady, I think your blazon to be true; though I'll

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: be sworn, if he be so, his conceit is false. Here, Claudio, I

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: have wooed in thy name, and fair Hero is won. I have broke with

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: her father, and his good will obtained. Name the day of marriage,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: and God give thee joy!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Count, take of me my daughter, and with her my fortunes. His

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Grace hath made the match, and all grace say Amen to it!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Speak, Count, 'tis your cue.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Silence is the perfectest herald of joy. I were but little

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: happy if I could say how much. Lady, as you are mine, I am yours.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I give away myself for you and dote upon the exchange.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Speak, cousin; or, if you cannot, stop his mouth with a kiss

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: and let not him speak neither.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. In faith, lady, you have a merry heart.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Yea, my lord; I thank it, poor fool, it keeps on the windy

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: side of care. My cousin tells him in his ear that he is in her

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: heart.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. And so she doth, cousin.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Good Lord, for alliance! Thus goes every one to the world but

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I, and I am sunburnt. I may sit in a corner and cry 'Heigh-ho for

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: a husband!'

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Lady Beatrice, I will get you one.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. I would rather have one of your father's getting. Hath your

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Grace ne'er a brother like you? Your father got excellent

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: husbands, if a maid could come by them.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Will you have me, lady?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. No, my lord, unless I might have another for working days:

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: your Grace is too costly to wear every day. But I beseech your

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Grace pardon me. I was born to speak all mirth and no matter.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Your silence most offends me, and to be merry best becomes

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: you, for out o' question you were born in a merry hour.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. No, sure, my lord, my mother cried; but then there was a star

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: danc'd, and under that was I born. Cousins, God give you joy!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Niece, will you look to those things I told you of?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. I cry you mercy, uncle, By your Grace's pardon.    Exit.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. By my troth, a pleasant-spirited lady.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. There's little of the melancholy element in her, my lord. She

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: is never sad but when she sleeps, and not ever sad then; for I

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: have heard my daughter say she hath often dreamt of unhappiness

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: and wak'd herself with laughing.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. She cannot endure to hear tell of a husband.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. O, by no means! She mocks all her wooers out of suit.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. She were an excellent wife for Benedick.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. O Lord, my lord! if they were but a week married, they would

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: talk themselves mad.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. County Claudio, when mean you to go to church?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. To-morrow, my lord. Time goes on crutches till love have all

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: his rites.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Not till Monday, my dear son, which is hence a just

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: sevennight; and a time too brief too, to have all things answer

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: my mind.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Come, you shake the head at so long a breathing;

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: but I warrant thee, Claudio, the time shall not go dully by us.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I will in the interim undertake one of Hercules' labours, which

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: is, to bring Signior Benedick and the Lady Beatrice into a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: mountain of affection th' one with th' other. I would fain have

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: it a match, and I doubt not but to fashion it if you three will

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: but minister such assistance as I shall give you direction.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. My lord, I am for you, though it cost me ten nights'

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: watchings.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. And I, my lord.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. And you too, gentle Hero?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero. I will do any modest office, my lord, to help my cousin to a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: good husband.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. And Benedick is not the unhopefullest husband that I know.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Thus far can I praise him: he is of a noble strain, of approved

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: valour, and confirm'd honesty. I will teach you how to humour

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: your cousin, that she shall fall in love with Benedick; and I,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: [to Leonato and Claudio] with your two helps, will so practise on

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Benedick that, in despite of his quick wit and his queasy

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: stomach, he shall fall in love with Beatrice. If we can do this,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Cupid is no longer an archer; his glory shall be ours, for we are

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the only love-gods. Go in with me, and I will tell you my drift.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Exeunt.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Scene II.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: A hall in Leonato's house.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter [Don] John and Borachio.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. It is so. The Count Claudio shall marry the daughter of

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leonato.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Yea, my lord; but I can cross it.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. Any bar, any cross, any impediment will be med'cinable to me.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I am sick in displeasure to him, and whatsoever comes athwart his

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: affection ranges evenly with mine. How canst thou cross this

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: marriage?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Not honestly, my lord, but so covertly that no dishonesty

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: shall appear in me.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. Show me briefly how.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. I think I told your lordship, a year since, how much I am in

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the favour of Margaret, the waiting gentlewoman to Hero.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. I remember.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. I can, at any unseasonable instant of the night, appoint her

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: to look out at her lady's chamber window.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. What life is in that to be the death of this marriage?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. The poison of that lies in you to temper. Go you to the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Prince your brother; spare not to tell him that he hath wronged

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: his honour in marrying the renowned Claudio (whose estimation do

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: you mightily hold up) to a contaminated stale, such a one as

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. What proof shall I make of that?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Proof enough to misuse the Prince, to vex Claudio, to undo

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero, and kill Leonato. Look you for any other issue?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. Only to despite them I will endeavour anything.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Go then; find me a meet hour to draw Don Pedro and the Count

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claudio alone; tell them that you know that Hero loves me; intend

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: a kind of zeal both to the Prince and Claudio, as--in love of

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: your brother's honour, who hath made this match, and his friend's

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: reputation, who is thus like to be cozen'd with the semblance of

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: a maid--that you have discover'd thus. They will scarcely believe

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: this without trial. Offer them instances; which shall bear no

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: less likelihood than to see me at her chamber window, hear me

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: call Margaret Hero, hear Margaret term me Claudio; and bring them

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: to see this the very night before the intended wedding (for in

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the meantime I will so fashion the matter that Hero shall be

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: absent) and there shall appear such seeming truth of Hero's

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: disloyalty that jealousy shall be call'd assurance and all the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: preparation overthrown.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. Grow this to what adverse issue it can, I will put it in

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: practice. Be cunning in the working this, and thy fee is a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: thousand ducats.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Be you constant in the accusation, and my cunning shall not

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: shame me.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. I will presently go learn their day of marriage.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Exeunt.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Scene III.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leonato's orchard.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Benedick alone.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Boy!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: [Enter Boy.]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Boy. Signior?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. In my chamber window lies a book. Bring it hither to me in

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the orchard.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Boy. I am here already, sir.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. I know that, but I would have thee hence and here again.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: (Exit Boy.) I do much wonder that one man, seeing how much

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: another man is a fool when he dedicates his behaviours to love,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: will, after he hath laugh'd at such shallow follies in others,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: become the argument of his own scorn by falling in love; and such

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: a man is Claudio. I have known when there was no music with him

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: but the drum and the fife; and now had he rather hear the tabor

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: and the pipe. I have known when he would have walk'd ten mile

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: afoot to see a good armour; and now will he lie ten nights awake

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: carving the fashion of a new doublet. He was wont to speak plain

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: and to the purpose, like an honest man and a soldier; and now is

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: he turn'd orthography; his words are a very fantastical banquet--

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: just so many strange dishes. May I be so converted and see with

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: these eyes? I cannot tell; I think not. I will not be sworn but

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: love may transform me to an oyster; but I'll take my oath on it,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: till he have made an oyster of me he shall never make me such a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: fool. One woman is fair, yet I am well; another is wise, yet I am

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: well; another virtuous, yet I am well; but till all graces be in

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: one woman, one woman shall not come in my grace. Rich she shall

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: be, that's certain; wise, or I'll none; virtuous, or I'll never

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: cheapen her; fair, or I'll never look on her; mild, or come not

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: near me; noble, or not I for an angel; of good discourse, an

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: excellent musician, and her hair shall be of what colour it

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: please God. Ha, the Prince and Monsieur Love! I will hide me in

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the arbour.                                         [Hides.]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Don Pedro, Leonato, Claudio.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Music [within].

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Come, shall we hear this music?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Yea, my good lord. How still the evening is,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: As hush'd on purpose to grace harmony!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. See you where Benedick hath hid himself?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. O, very well, my lord. The music ended,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: We'll fit the kid-fox with a pennyworth.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Balthasar with Music.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Come, Balthasar, we'll hear that song again.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Balth. O, good my lord, tax not so bad a voice

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: To slander music any more than once.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. It is the witness still of excellency

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: To put a strange face on his own perfection.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I pray thee sing, and let me woo no more.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Balth. Because you talk of wooing, I will sing,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Since many a wooer doth commence his suit

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: To her he thinks not worthy, yet he wooes,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Yet will he swear he loves.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Nay, pray thee come;

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Or if thou wilt hold longer argument,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Do it in notes.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Balth. Note this before my notes:

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: There's not a note of mine that's worth the noting.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Why, these are very crotchets that he speaks!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Note notes, forsooth, and nothing!                  [Music.]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. [aside] Now divine air! Now is his soul ravish'd! Is it not

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: strange that sheep's guts should hale souls out of men's bodies?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Well, a horn for my money, when all's done.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: [Balthasar sings.]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: The Song.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Sigh no more, ladies, sigh no more!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Men were deceivers ever,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: One foot in sea, and one on shore;

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: To one thing constant never.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Then sigh not so,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: But let them go,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And be you blithe and bonny,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Converting all your sounds of woe

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Into Hey nonny, nonny.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Sing no more ditties, sing no moe,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Of dumps so dull and heavy!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: The fraud of men was ever so,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Since summer first was leavy.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Then sigh not so, &c.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. By my troth, a good song.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Balth. And an ill singer, my lord.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Ha, no, no, faith! Thou sing'st well enough for a shift.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. [aside] An he had been a dog that should have howl'd thus,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: they would have hang'd him; and I pray God his bad voice bode no

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: mischief. I had as live have heard the night raven, come what

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: plague could have come after it.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Yea, marry. Dost thou hear, Balthasar? I pray thee get us

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: some excellent music; for to-morrow night we would have it at the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Lady Hero's chamber window.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Balth. The best I can, my lord.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Do so. Farewell.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Exit Balthasar [with Musicians].

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Come hither, Leonato. What was it you told me of to-day? that

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: your niece Beatrice was in love with Signior Benedick?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. O, ay!-[Aside to Pedro] Stalk on, stalk on; the fowl sits.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: --I did never think that lady would have loved any man.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. No, nor I neither; but most wonderful that she should so dote

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: on Signior Benedick, whom she hath in all outward behaviours

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: seem'd ever to abhor.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. [aside] Is't possible? Sits the wind in that corner?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. By my troth, my lord, I cannot tell what to think of it, but

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: that she loves him with an enraged affection. It is past the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: infinite of thought.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. May be she doth but counterfeit.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Faith, like enough.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. O God, counterfeit? There was never counterfeit of passion

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: came so near the life of passion as she discovers it.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Why, what effects of passion shows she?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. [aside] Bait the hook well! This fish will bite.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. What effects, my lord? She will sit you--you heard my

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: daughter tell you how.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. She did indeed.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. How, how, I pray you? You amaze me. I would have thought her

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: spirit had been invincible against all assaults of affection.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. I would have sworn it had, my lord--especially against

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Benedick.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. [aside] I should think this a gull but that the white-bearded

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: fellow speaks it. Knavery cannot, sure, hide himself in such

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: reverence.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. [aside] He hath ta'en th' infection. Hold it up.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Hath she made her affection known to Benedick?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. No, and swears she never will. That's her torment.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. 'Tis true indeed. So your daughter says. 'Shall I,' says

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: she, 'that have so oft encount'red him with scorn, write to him

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: that I love him?'"

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. This says she now when she is beginning to write to him; for

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: she'll be up twenty times a night, and there will she sit in her

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: smock till she have writ a sheet of paper. My daughter tells us

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: all.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Now you talk of a sheet of paper, I remember a pretty jest

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: your daughter told us of.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. O, when she had writ it, and was reading it over, she found

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 'Benedick' and 'Beatrice' between the sheet?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. That.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. O, she tore the letter into a thousand halfpence, rail'd at

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: herself that she should be so immodest to write to one that she

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: knew would flout her. 'I measure him,' says she, 'by my own

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: spirit; for I should flout him if he writ to me. Yea, though I

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: love him, I should.'

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Then down upon her knees she falls, weeps, sobs, beats her

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: heart, tears her hair, prays, curses--'O sweet Benedick! God give

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: me patience!'

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. She doth indeed; my daughter says so. And the ecstasy hath so

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: much overborne her that my daughter is sometime afeard she will

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: do a desperate outrage to herself. It is very true.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. It were good that Benedick knew of it by some other, if she

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: will not discover it.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. To what end? He would make but a sport of it and torment the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: poor lady worse.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. An he should, it were an alms to hang him! She's an

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: excellent sweet lady, and (out of all suspicion) she is virtuous.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. And she is exceeding wise.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. In everything but in loving Benedick.

title: Much Ado about Nothing

title: Much Ado about Nothing

text: breath of her accustomed crossness.

text: 'tis

title: Much Ado about Nothing

text: Claud. He is a very proper man.

text: Pedro. He hath indeed a good outward happiness.

text: Claud. Before God! and in my mind, very wise.

text: Pedro. He doth indeed show some sparks that are like wit.

text: Claud. And I take him to be valiant.

text: Pedro. As Hector, I assure you; and in the managing of quarrels you

text: may say he is wise, for either he avoids them with great

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: discretion, or undertakes them with a most Christianlike fear.

text: Leon. If he do fear God, 'a must necessarily keep peace. If he

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: break the peace, he ought to enter into a quarrel with fear and

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: trembling.

text: Bene. This can be no trick. The conference was sadly borne; they

title: Much Ado about Nothing

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: It seems her affections have their full bent. Love me? Why, it

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: must be requited. I hear how I am censur'd. They say I will bear

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: myself proudly if I perceive the love come from her. They say too
