text: that she will rather die than give any sign of affection. I did

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: never think to marry. I must not seem proud. Happy are they that

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: hear their detractions and can put them to mending. They say the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: lady is fair--'tis a truth, I can bear them witness; and virtuous

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: --'tis so, I cannot reprove it; and wise, but for loving me--by

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: my troth, it is no addition to her wit, nor no great argument of

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: her folly, for I will be horribly in love with her. I may chance

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: have some odd quirks and remnants of wit broken on me because I

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: have railed so long against marriage. But doth not the appetite

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: alters? A man loves the meat in his youth that he cannot endure

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: in his age. Shall quips and sentences and these paper bullets of

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the brain awe a man from the career of his humour? No, the world

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: must be peopled. When I said I would die a bachelor, I did not

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: think I should live till I were married.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Beatrice.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Here comes Beatrice. By this day, she's a fair lady! I do spy

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: some marks of love in her.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Against my will I am sent to bid You come in to dinner.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Fair Beatrice, I thank you for your pains.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. I took no more pains for those thanks than you take pains to

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: thank me. If it had been painful, I would not have come.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. You take pleasure then in the message?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Yea, just so much as you may take upon a knives point, and

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: choke a daw withal. You have no stomach, signior. Fare you well. Exit.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Ha! 'Against my will I am sent to bid you come in to dinner.'

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: There's a double meaning in that. 'I took no more pains for those

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: thanks than you took pains to thank me.' That's as much as to

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: say, 'Any pains that I take for you is as easy as thanks.' If I

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: do not take pity of her, I am a villain; if I do not love her, I

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: am a Jew. I will go get her picture.                   Exit.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: thee to disgrace her.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. I will disparage her no farther till you are my witnesses.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bear it coldly but till midnight, and let the issue show itself.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. O day untowardly turned!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. O mischief strangely thwarting!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John. O plague right well prevented!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: So will you say when you have seen the Sequel.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Exeunt.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Scene III.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: A street.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Dogberry and his compartner [Verges], with the Watch.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Are you good men and true?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Verg. Yea, or else it were pity but they should suffer salvation,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: body and soul.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Nay, that were a punishment too good for them if they should

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: have any allegiance in them, being chosen for the Prince's watch.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Verg. Well, give them their charge, neighbour Dogberry.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. First, who think you the most desartless man to be constable?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 1. Watch. Hugh Oatcake, sir, or George Seacoal; for they can write

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: and read.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Come hither, neighbour Seacoal. God hath bless'd you with a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: good name. To be a well-favoured man is the gift of fortune, but

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: to write and read comes by nature.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 2. Watch. Both which, Master Constable--

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. You have. I knew it would be your answer. Well, for your

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: favour, sir, why, give God thanks and make no boast of it; and

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: for your writing and reading, let that appear when there is no

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: need of such vanity. You are thought here to be the most

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: senseless and fit man for the constable of the watch. Therefore

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: bear you the lanthorn. This is your charge: you shall comprehend

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: all vagrom men; you are to bid any man stand, in the Prince's

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: name.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 2. Watch. How if 'a will not stand?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Why then, take no note of him, but let him go, and presently

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: call the rest of the watch together and thank God you are rid of

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: a knave.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Verg. If he will not stand when he is bidden, he is none of the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Prince's subjects.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. True, and they are to meddle with none but the Prince's

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: subjects. You shall also make no noise in the streets; for for

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the watch to babble and to talk is most tolerable, and not to be

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: endured.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 2. Watch. We will rather sleep than talk. We know what belongs to

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: a watch.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Why, you speak like an ancient and most quiet watchman, for I

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: cannot see how sleeping should offend. Only have a care that your

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: bills be not stol'n. Well, you are to call at all the alehouses

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: and bid those that are drunk get them to bed.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 2. Watch. How if they will not?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Why then, let them alone till they are sober. If they make you

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: not then the better answer, You may say they are not the men you

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: took them for.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 2. Watch. Well, sir.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. If you meet a thief, you may suspect him, by virtue of your

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: office, to be no true man; and for such kind of men, the less you

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: meddle or make with them, why, the more your honesty.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 2. Watch. If we know him to be a thief, shall we not lay hands on

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: him?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Truly, by your office you may; but I think they that touch

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: pitch will be defil'd. The most peaceable way for you, if you do

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: take a thief, is to let him show himself what he is, and steal

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: out of your company.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Verg. You have been always called a merciful man, partner.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Truly, I would not hang a dog by my will, much more a man who

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: hath any honesty in him.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Verg. If you hear a child cry in the night, you must call to the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: nurse and bid her still it.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 2. Watch. How if the nurse be asleep and will not hear us?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Why then, depart in peace and let the child wake her with

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: crying; for the ewe that will not hear her lamb when it baes will

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: never answer a calf when he bleats.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Verg. 'Tis very true.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. This is the end of the charge: you, constable, are to present

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the Prince's own person. If you meet the Prince in the night,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: you may stay him.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Verg. Nay, by'r lady, that I think 'a cannot.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Five shillings to one on't with any man that knows the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: statutes, he may stay him! Marry, not without the Prince be

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: willing; for indeed the watch ought to offend no man, and it is

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: an offence to stay a man against his will.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Verg. By'r lady, I think it be so.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Ha, ah, ha! Well, masters, good night. An there be any matter

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: of weight chances, call up me. Keep your fellows' counsels and

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: your own, and good night. Come, neighbour.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 2. Watch. Well, masters, we hear our charge. Let us go sit here

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: upon the church bench till two, and then all to bed.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. One word more, honest neighbours. I pray you watch about

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Signior Leonato's door; for the wedding being there tomorrow,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: there is a great coil to-night. Adieu. Be vigitant, I beseech

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: you.                           Exeunt [Dogberry and Verges].

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Borachio and Conrade.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. What, Conrade!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 2. Watch. [aside] Peace! stir not!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Conrade, I say!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. Here, man. I am at thy elbow.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Mass, and my elbow itch'd! I thought there would a scab

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: follow.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. I will owe thee an answer for that; and now forward with thy

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: tale.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Stand thee close then under this penthouse, for it drizzles

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: rain, and I will, like a true drunkard, utter all to thee.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 2. Watch. [aside] Some treason, masters. Yet stand close.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Therefore know I have earned of Don John a thousand ducats.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. Is it possible that any villany should be so dear?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Thou shouldst rather ask if it were possible any villany

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: should be so rich; for when rich villains have need of poor ones,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: poor ones may make what price they will.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. I wonder at it.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. That shows thou art unconfirm'd. Thou knowest that the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: fashion of a doublet, or a hat, or a cloak, is nothing to a man.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. Yes, it is apparel.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. I mean the fashion.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. Yes, the fashion is the fashion.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Tush! I may as well say the fool's the fool. But seest thou

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: not what a deformed thief this fashion is?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 2. Watch. [aside] I know that Deformed. 'A bas been a vile thief

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: this seven year; 'a goes up and down like a gentleman. I remember

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: his name.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Didst thou not hear somebody?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. No; 'twas the vane on the house.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Seest thou not, I say, what a deformed thief this fashion is?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: how giddily 'a turns about all the hot-bloods between fourteen

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: and five-and-thirty? sometimes fashioning them like Pharaoh's

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: soldiers in the reechy painting, sometime like god Bel's priests

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: in the old church window, sometime like the shaven Hercules in

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the smirch'd worm-eaten tapestry, where his codpiece seems as

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: massy as his club?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. All this I see; and I see that the fashion wears out more

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: apparel than the man. But art not thou thyself giddy with the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: fashion too, that thou hast shifted out of thy tale into telling

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: me of the fashion?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Not so neither. But know that I have to-night wooed Margaret,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the Lady Hero's gentlewoman, by the name of Hero. She leans me

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: out at her mistress' chamber window, bids me a thousand times

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: good night--I tell this tale vilely; I should first tell thee how

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the Prince, Claudio and my master, planted and placed and

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: possessed by my master Don John, saw afar off in the orchard this

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: amiable encounter.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. And thought they Margaret was Hero?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Two of them did, the Prince and Claudio; but the devil my

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: master knew she was Margaret; and partly by his oaths, which

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: first possess'd them, partly by the dark night, which did deceive

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: them, but chiefly by my villany, which did confirm any slander

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: that Don John had made, away went Claudio enrag'd; swore he would

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: meet her, as he was appointed, next morning at the temple, and

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: there, before the whole congregation, shame her with what he saw

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: o'ernight and send her home again without a husband.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 2. Watch. We charge you in the Prince's name stand!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 1. Watch. Call up the right Master Constable. We have here

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: recover'd the most dangerous piece of lechery that ever was known

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: in the commonwealth.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 2. Watch. And one Deformed is one of them. I know him; 'a wears a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: lock.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. Masters, masters--

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 1. Watch. You'll be made bring Deformed forth, I warrant you.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. Masters--

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 2. Watch. Never speak, we charge you. Let us obey you to go with

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: us.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. We are like to prove a goodly commodity, being taken up of

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: these men's bills.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. A commodity in question, I warrant you. Come, we'll obey you.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Exeunt.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Scene IV.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: A Room in Leonato's house.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Hero, and Margaret and Ursula.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero. Good Ursula, wake my cousin Beatrice and desire her to rise.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Urs. I will, lady.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero. And bid her come hither.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Urs. Well.                                             [Exit.]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. Troth, I think your other rebato were better.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero. No, pray thee, good Meg, I'll wear this.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. By my troth, 's not so good, and I warrant your cousin will

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: say so.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero. My cousin's a fool, and thou art another. I'll wear none but

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: this.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. I like the new tire within excellently, if the hair were a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: thought browner; and your gown's a most rare fashion, i' faith.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I saw the Duchess of Milan's gown that they praise so.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero. O, that exceeds, they say.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. By my troth, 's but a nightgown in respect of yours--

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: cloth-o'-gold and cuts, and lac'd with silver, set with pearls

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: down sleeves, side-sleeves, and skirts, round underborne with

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: a blush tinsel. But for a fine, quaint, graceful, and excellent

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: fashion, yours is worth ten on't.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero. God give me joy to wear it! for my heart is exceeding heavy.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. 'Twill be heavier soon by the weight of a man.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero. Fie upon thee! art not ashamed?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. Of what, lady? of speaking honourably? Is not marriage

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: honourable in a beggar? Is not your lord honourable without

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: marriage? I think you would have me say, 'saving your reverence,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: a husband.' An bad thinking do not wrest true speaking, I'll

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: offend nobody. Is there any harm in 'the heavier for a husband'?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: None, I think, an it be the right husband and the right wife.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Otherwise 'tis light, and not heavy. Ask my Lady Beatrice else.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Here she comes.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Beatrice.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero. Good morrow, coz.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Good morrow, sweet Hero.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero. Why, how now? Do you speak in the sick tune?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. I am out of all other tune, methinks.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. Clap's into 'Light o' love.' That goes without a burden. Do

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: you sing it, and I'll dance it.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Yea, 'Light o' love' with your heels! then, if your husband

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: have stables enough, you'll see he shall lack no barnes.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. O illegitimate construction! I scorn that with my heels.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. 'Tis almost five o'clock, cousin; 'tis time you were ready.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: By my troth, I am exceeding ill. Hey-ho!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. For a hawk, a horse, or a husband?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. For the letter that begins them all, H.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. Well, an you be not turn'd Turk, there's no more sailing by

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the star.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. What means the fool, trow?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. Nothing I; but God send every one their heart's desire!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero. These gloves the Count sent me, they are an excellent

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: perfume.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. I am stuff'd, cousin; I cannot smell.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. A maid, and stuff'd! There's goodly catching of cold.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. O, God help me! God help me! How long have you profess'd

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: apprehension?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. Ever since you left it. Doth not my wit become me rarely?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. It is not seen enough. You should wear it in your cap. By my

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: troth, I am sick.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. Get you some of this distill'd carduus benedictus and lay it

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: to your heart. It is the only thing for a qualm.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero. There thou prick'st her with a thistle.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. Benedictus? why benedictus? You have some moral in this

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 'benedictus.'

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. Moral? No, by my troth, I have no moral meaning; I meant

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: plain holy thistle. You may think perchance that I think you are

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: in love. Nay, by'r lady, I am not such a fool to think what I

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: list; nor I list not to think what I can; nor indeed I cannot

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: think, if I would think my heart out of thinking, that you are in

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: love, or that you will be in love, or that you can be in love.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Yet Benedick was such another, and now is he become a man. He

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: swore he would never marry; and yet now in despite of his heart

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: he eats his meat without grudging; and how you may be converted I

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: know not, but methinks you look with your eyes as other women do.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Beat. What pace is this that thy tongue keeps?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Marg. Not a false gallop.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Ursula.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Urs. Madam, withdraw. The Prince, the Count, Signior Benedick, Don

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: John, and all the gallants of the town are come to fetch you to

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: church.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Hero. Help to dress me, good coz, good Meg, good Ursula.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: [Exeunt.]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Scene V.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: The hall in Leonato's house.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Leonato and the Constable [Dogberry] and the Headborough

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: [verges].

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. What would you with me, honest neighbour?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Marry, sir, I would have some confidence with you that decerns

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: you nearly.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Brief, I pray you; for you see it is a busy time with me.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Marry, this it is, sir.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Verg. Yes, in truth it is, sir.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. What is it, my good friends?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Goodman Verges, sir, speaks a little off the matter--an old

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: man, sir, and his wits are not so blunt as, God help, I would

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: desire they were; but, in faith, honest as the skin between his

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: brows.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Verg. Yes, I thank God I am as honest as any man living that is an

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: old man and no honester than I.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Comparisons are odorous. Palabras, neighbour Verges.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Neighbours, you are tedious.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. It pleases your worship to say so, but we are the poor Duke's

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: officers; but truly, for mine own part, if I were as tedious as a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: king, I could find in my heart to bestow it all of your worship.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. All thy tediousness on me, ah?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Yea, in 'twere a thousand pound more than 'tis; for I hear as

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: good exclamation on your worship as of any man in the city; and

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: though I be but a poor man, I am glad to hear it.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Verg. And so am I.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. I would fain know what you have to say.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Verg. Marry, sir, our watch to-night, excepting your worship's

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: presence, ha' ta'en a couple of as arrant knaves as any in

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Messina.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. A good old man, sir; he will be talking. As they say,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 'When

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: the age is in, the wit is out.' God help us! it is a world to

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: see! Well said, i' faith, neighbour Verges. Well, God's a good

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: man. An two men ride of a horse, one must ride behind. An honest

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: soul, i' faith, sir, by my troth he is, as ever broke bread; but

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: God is to be worshipp'd; all men are not alike, alas, good

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: neighbour!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Indeed, neighbour, he comes too short of you.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Gifts that God gives.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. I must leave you.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. One word, sir. Our watch, sir, have indeed comprehended two

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: aspicious persons, and we would have them this morning examined

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: before your worship.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Take their examination yourself and bring it me. I am now in

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: great haste, as it may appear unto you.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. It shall be suffigance.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Drink some wine ere you go. Fare you well.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: [Enter a Messenger.]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Mess. My lord, they stay for you to give your daughter to her

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: husband.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. I'll wait upon them. I am ready.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: [Exeunt Leonato and Messenger.]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Go, good partner, go get you to Francis Seacoal; bid him bring

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: his pen and inkhorn to the jail. We are now to examination these

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: men.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Verg. And we must do it wisely.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. We will spare for no wit, I warrant you. Here's that shall

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: drive some of them to a non-come. Only get the learned writer to

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: set down our excommunication, and meet me at the jail.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: [Exeunt.]

text: Scene II.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: A prison.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter the Constables [Dogberry and Verges] and the Sexton, in gowns,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: [and the Watch, with Conrade and] Borachio.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Is our whole dissembly appear'd?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Verg. O, a stool and a cushion for the sexton.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Sex. Which be the malefactors?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Marry, that am I and my partner.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Verg. Nay, that's certain. We have the exhibition to examine.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Sex. But which are the offenders that are to be examined? let them

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: come before Master Constable.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Yea, marry, let them come before me. What is your name,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: friend?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bor. Borachio.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Pray write down Borachio. Yours, sirrah?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. I am a gentleman, sir, and my name is Conrade.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Write down Master Gentleman Conrade. Masters, do you serve

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: God?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Both. Yea, sir, we hope.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Write down that they hope they serve God; and write God first,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: for God defend but God should go before such villains! Masters,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: it is proved already that you are little better than false

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: knaves, and it will go near to be thought so shortly. How answer

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: you for yourselves?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. Marry, sir, we say we are none.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. A marvellous witty fellow, I assure you; but I will go about

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: with him. Come you hither, sirrah. A word in your ear. Sir, I say

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: to you, it is thought you are false knaves.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Sir, I say to you we are none.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Well, stand aside. Fore God, they are both in a tale.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Have you writ down that they are none?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Sex. Master Constable, you go not the way to examine. You must call

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: forth the watch that are their accusers.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Yea, marry, that's the eftest way. Let the watch come forth.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Masters, I charge you in the Prince's name accuse these men.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 1. Watch. This man said, sir, that Don John the Prince's brother

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: was a villain.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Write down Prince John a villain. Why, this is flat perjury,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: to call a prince's brother villain.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bora. Master Constable--

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Pray thee, fellow, peace. I do not like thy look, I promise

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: thee.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Sex. What heard you him say else?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 2. Watch. Marry, that he had received a thousand ducats of Don John

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: for accusing the Lady Hero wrongfully.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Flat burglary as ever was committed.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Verg. Yea, by th' mass, that it is.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Sex. What else, fellow?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 1. Watch. And that Count Claudio did mean, upon his words, to

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: disgrace Hero before the whole assembly, and not marry her.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. O villain! thou wilt be condemn'd into everlasting redemption

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: for this.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Sex. What else?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Watchmen. This is all.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Sex. And this is more, masters, than you can deny. Prince John is

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: this morning secretly stol'n away. Hero was in this manner

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: accus'd, in this manner refus'd, and upon the grief of this

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: suddenly died. Master Constable, let these men be bound and

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: brought to Leonato's. I will go before and show him their

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: examination.                                         [Exit.]

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Come, let them be opinion'd.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Verg. Let them be in the hands--

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. Off, coxcomb!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. God's my life, where's the sexton? Let him write down the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Prince's officer coxcomb. Come, bind them.--Thou naughty varlet!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Con. Away! you are an ass, you are an ass.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Dog. Dost thou not suspect my place? Dost thou not suspect my

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: years? O that he were here to write me down an ass! But, masters,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: remember that I am an ass. Though it be not written down, yet

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: forget not that I am an ass. No, thou villain, thou art full of

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: piety, as shall be prov'd upon thee by good witness. I am a wise

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: fellow; and which is more, an officer; and which is more, a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: householder; and which is more, as pretty a piece of flesh as any

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: is in Messina, and one that knows the law, go to! and a rich

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: fellow enough, go to! and a fellow that hath had losses; and one

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: that hath two gowns and everything handsome about him. Bring him

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: away. O that I had been writ down an ass!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Exeunt.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: The street, near Leonato's house.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Leonato and his brother [ Antonio].

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Ant. If you go on thus, you will kill yourself,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And 'tis not wisdom thus to second grief

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Against yourself.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. I pray thee cease thy counsel,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Which falls into mine ears as profitless

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: As water in a sieve. Give not me counsel,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Nor let no comforter delight mine ear

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: But such a one whose wrongs do suit with mine.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bring me a father that so lov'd his child,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Whose joy of her is overwhelm'd like mine,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And bid him speak to me of patience.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Measure his woe the length and breadth of mine,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And let it answer every strain for strain,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: As thus for thus, and such a grief for such,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: In every lineament, branch, shape, and form.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: If such a one will smile and stroke his beard,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bid sorrow wag, cry 'hem' when he should groan,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Patch grief with proverbs, make misfortune drunk

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: With candle-wasters--bring him yet to me,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And I of him will gather patience.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: But there is no such man; for, brother, men

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Can counsel and speak comfort to that grief

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Which they themselves not feel; but, tasting it,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Their counsel turns to passion, which before

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Would give preceptial medicine to rage,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Fetter strong madness in a silken thread,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Charm ache with air and agony with words.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: No, no! 'Tis all men's office to speak patience

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: To those that wring under the load of sorrow,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: But no man's virtue nor sufficiency

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: To be so moral when he shall endure

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: The like himself. Therefore give me no counsel.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: My griefs cry louder than advertisement.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Ant. Therein do men from children nothing differ.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. I pray thee peace. I will be flesh and blood;

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: For there was never yet philosopher

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: That could endure the toothache patiently,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: However they have writ the style of gods

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And made a push at chance and sufferance.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Ant. Yet bend not all the harm upon yourself.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Make those that do offend you suffer too.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. There thou speak'st reason. Nay, I will do so.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: My soul doth tell me Hero is belied;

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And that shall Claudio know; so shall the Prince,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And all of them that thus dishonour her.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Don Pedro and Claudio.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Ant. Here comes the Prince and Claudio hastily.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Good den, Good den.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Good day to both of you.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Hear you, my lords!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. We have some haste, Leonato.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Some haste, my lord! well, fare you well, my lord.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Are you so hasty now? Well, all is one.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Nay, do not quarrel with us, good old man.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Ant. If he could right himself with quarrelling,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Some of us would lie low.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Who wrongs him?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Marry, thou dost wrong me, thou dissembler, thou!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Nay, never lay thy hand upon thy sword;

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I fear thee not.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Mary, beshrew my hand

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: If it should give your age such cause of fear.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: In faith, my hand meant nothing to my sword.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Tush, tush, man! never fleer and jest at me

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I speak not like a dotard nor a fool,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: As under privilege of age to brag

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: What I have done being young, or what would do,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Were I not old. Know, Claudio, to thy head,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Thou hast so wrong'd mine innocent child and me

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: That I am forc'd to lay my reverence by

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And, with grey hairs and bruise of many days,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Do challenge thee to trial of a man.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I say thou hast belied mine innocent child;

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Thy slander hath gone through and through her heart,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And she lied buried with her ancestors-

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: O, in a tomb where never scandal slept,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Save this of hers, fram'd by thy villany!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. My villany?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Thine, Claudio; thine I say.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. You say not right, old man.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. My lord, my lord,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I'll prove it on his body if he dare,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Despite his nice fence and his active practice,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: His May of youth and bloom of lustihood.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Away! I will not have to do with you.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Canst thou so daff me? Thou hast kill'd my child.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: If thou kill'st me, boy, thou shalt kill a man.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And. He shall kill two of us, and men indeed

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: But that's no matter; let him kill one first.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Win me and wear me! Let him answer me.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Come, follow me, boy,. Come, sir boy, come follow me.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Sir boy, I'll whip you from your foining fence!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Nay, as I am a gentleman, I will.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Brother--

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Ant. Content yourself. God knows I lov'd my niece,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And she is dead, slander'd to death by villains,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: That dare as well answer a man indeed

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: As I dare take a serpent by the tongue.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Boys, apes, braggarts, jacks, milksops!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. Brother Anthony--

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Ant. Hold you content. What, man! I know them, yea,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And what they weigh, even to the utmost scruple,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Scambling, outfacing, fashion-monging boys,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: That lie and cog and flout, deprave and slander,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Go anticly, show outward hideousness,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And speak off half a dozen dang'rous words,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: How they might hurt their enemies, if they durst;

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: And this is all.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. But, brother Anthony--

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Ant. Come, 'tis no matter.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Do not you meddle; let me deal in this.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Gentlemen both, we will not wake your patience.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: My heart is sorry for your daughter's death;

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: But, on my honour, she was charg'd with nothing

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: But what was true, and very full of proof.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. My lord, my lord--

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. I will not hear you.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Leon. No? Come, brother, away!--I will be heard.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Ant. And shall, or some of us will smart for it.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Exeunt ambo.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Enter Benedick.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. See, see! Here comes the man we went to seek.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Now, signior, what news?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Good day, my lord.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Welcome, signior. You are almost come to part almost a fray.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. We had lik'd to have had our two noses snapp'd off with two

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: old men without teeth.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Leonato and his brother. What think'st thou? Had we fought,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: I doubt we should have been too young for them.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. In a false quarrel there is no true valour. I came to seek

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: you both.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. We have been up and down to seek thee; for we are high-proof

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: melancholy, and would fain have it beaten away. Wilt thou use thy

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: wit?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. It is in my scabbard. Shall I draw it?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Dost thou wear thy wit by thy side?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Never any did so, though very many have been beside their

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: wit. I will bid thee draw, as we do the minstrel--draw to

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: pleasure us.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. As I am an honest man, he looks pale. Art thou sick or

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: angry?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. What, courage, man! What though care kill'd a cat, thou hast

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: mettle enough in thee to kill care.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Sir, I shall meet your wit in the career an you charge it

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: against me. I pray you choose another subject.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Nay then, give him another staff; this last was broke cross.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. By this light, he changes more and more. I think he be angry

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: indeed.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. If he be, he knows how to turn his girdle.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Shall I speak a word in your ear?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. God bless me from a challenge!

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. [aside to Claudio] You are a villain. I jest not; I will make

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: it good how you dare, with what you dare, and when you dare. Do

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: me right, or I will protest your cowardice. You have kill'd a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: sweet lady, and her death shall fall heavy on you. Let me hear

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: from you.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. Well, I will meet you, so I may have good cheer.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. What, a feast, a feast?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. I' faith, I thank him, he hath bid me to a calve's head and

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: a capon, the which if I do not carve most curiously, say my

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: knife's naught. Shall I not find a woodcock too?

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Bene. Sir, your wit ambles well; it goes easily.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. I'll tell thee how Beatrice prais'd thy wit the other day. I

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: said thou hadst a fine wit: 'True,' said she, 'a fine little

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: one.' 'No,' said I, 'a great wit.' 'Right,' says she, 'a great

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: gross one.' 'Nay,' said I, 'a good wit.' 'Just,' said she,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 'it

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: hurts nobody.' 'Nay,' said I, 'the gentleman is wise.'

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: 'Certain,'

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: said she, a wise gentleman.' 'Nay,' said I, 'he hath the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: tongues.' 'That I believe' said she, 'for he swore a thing to me

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: on Monday night which he forswore on Tuesday morning. There's a

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: double tongue; there's two tongues.' Thus did she an hour

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: together transshape thy particular virtues. Yet at last she

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: concluded with a sigh, thou wast the proper'st man in Italy.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Claud. For the which she wept heartily and said she cared not.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Yea, that she did; but yet, for all that, an if she did not

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: hate him deadly, she would love him dearly. The old man's

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: daughter told us all.

text: Claud. All, all! and moreover, God saw him when he was hid in the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: garden.

text: Pedro. But when shall we set the savage bull's horns on the

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: sensible Benedick's head?

text: Claud. Yea, and text underneath, 'Here dwells Benedick, the married

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: man'?

text: Bene. Fare you well, boy; you know my mind. I will leave you now to

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: your gossiplike humour. You break jests as braggards do their

title: Much Ado about Nothing

text: courtesies I thank you. I must discontinue your company. Your

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: brother the bastard is fled from Messina. You have among you

text: kill'd a sweet and innocent lady. For my Lord Lackbeard there, he

text: and I shall meet; and till then peace be with him.

text: Conrade and Borachio.

text: such a man.

text: Did he not say my brother was fled?

text: weigh more reasons in her balance. Nay, an you be a cursing

text: Pedro. How now? two of my brother's men bound? Borachio one.

text: Claud. Hearken after their offence, my lord.

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: Pedro. Officers, what offence have these men done?

title: Much Ado about Nothing

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: have spoken untruths; secondarily, they are slanders; sixth and

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: lastly, they have belied a lady; thirdly, they have verified

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: unjust things; and to conclude, they are lying knaves.

text: Pedro. First, I ask thee what they have done; thirdly, I ask thee

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: what's their offence; sixth and lastly, why they are committed;

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: and to conclude, what you lay to their charge.

text: Claud. Rightly reasoned, and in his own division; and by my troth

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: there's one meaning well suited.

text: Pedro. Who have you offended, masters, that you are thus bound to

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: your answer? This learned constable is too cunning to be

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: understood. What's your offence?

text: Bora. Sweet Prince, let me go no farther to mine answer. Do you

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: hear me, and let this Count kill me. I have deceived even your

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: very eyes. What your wisdoms could not discover, these shallow

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: fools have brought to light, who in the night overheard me

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: confessing to this man, how Don John your brother incensed me to

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: slander the Lady Hero; how you were brought into the orchard and

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: saw me court Margaret in Hero's garments; how you disgrac'd her

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: when you should marry her. My villany they have upon record,

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: which I had rather seal with my death than repeat over to my

title: Much Ado about Nothing
text: shame. The lady is dead upon mine and my master's false

title: Much Ado about Nothing

title: Much Ado about Nothing
