title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: How long within this wood intend you stay?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: TITANIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Perchance till after Theseus' wedding-day.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: If you will patiently dance in our round,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And see our moonlight revels, go with us;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: If not, shun me, and I will spare your haunts.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Give me that boy and I will go with thee.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: TITANIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Not for thy fairy kingdom. Fairies, away:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: We shall chide downright if I longer stay.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit TITANIA with her Train.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Well, go thy way: thou shalt not from this grove

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Till I torment thee for this injury.--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: My gentle Puck, come hither: thou remember'st

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Since once I sat upon a promontory,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And heard a mermaid, on a dolphin's back,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Uttering such dulcet and harmonious breath,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That the rude sea grew civil at her song,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And certain stars shot madly from their spheres

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To hear the sea-maid's music.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I remember.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That very time I saw,--but thou couldst not,--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Flying between the cold moon and the earth,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Cupid, all arm'd: a certain aim he took

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: At a fair vestal, throned by the west;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And loos'd his love-shaft smartly from his bow,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: As it should pierce a hundred thousand hearts;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But I might see young Cupid's fiery shaft

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Quench'd in the chaste beams of the watery moon;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And the imperial votaress passed on,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: In maiden meditation, fancy-free.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Yet mark'd I where the bolt of Cupid fell:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: It fell upon a little western flower,--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Before milk-white, now purple with love's wound,--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And maidens call it love-in-idleness.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Fetch me that flower, the herb I showed thee once:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The juice of it on sleeping eyelids laid

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Will make or man or woman madly dote

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Upon the next live creature that it sees.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Fetch me this herb: and be thou here again

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Ere the leviathan can swim a league.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I'll put a girdle round about the earth

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: In forty minutes.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit PUCK.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Having once this juice,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I'll watch Titania when she is asleep,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And drop the liquor of it in her eyes:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The next thing then she waking looks upon,--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Be it on lion, bear, or wolf, or bull,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: On meddling monkey, or on busy ape,--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: She shall pursue it with the soul of love.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And ere I take this charm from off her sight,--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: As I can take it with another herb,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I'll make her render up her page to me.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But who comes here? I am invisible;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And I will overhear their conference.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter DEMETRIUS, HELENA following him.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I love thee not, therefore pursue me not.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Where is Lysander and fair Hermia?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The one I'll slay, the other slayeth me.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thou told'st me they were stol'n into this wood,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And here am I, and wode within this wood,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Because I cannot meet with Hermia.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Hence, get thee gone, and follow me no more.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You draw me, you hard-hearted adamant;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But yet you draw not iron, for my heart

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Is true as steel. Leave you your power to draw,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And I shall have no power to follow you.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Do I entice you? Do I speak you fair?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Or, rather, do I not in plainest truth

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Tell you I do not, nor I cannot love you?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And even for that do I love you the more.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I am your spaniel; and, Demetrius,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The more you beat me, I will fawn on you:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Use me but as your spaniel, spurn me, strike me,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Neglect me, lose me; only give me leave,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Unworthy as I am, to follow you.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What worser place can I beg in your love,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And yet a place of high respect with me,--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Than to be used as you use your dog?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Tempt not too much the hatred of my spirit;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For I am sick when I do look on thee.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And I am sick when I look not on you.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You do impeach your modesty too much,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To leave the city, and commit yourself

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Into the hands of one that loves you not;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To trust the opportunity of night,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And the ill counsel of a desert place,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: With the rich worth of your virginity.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Your virtue is my privilege for that.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: It is not night when I do see your face,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Therefore I think I am not in the night;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Nor doth this wood lack worlds of company;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For you, in my respect, are all the world:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Then how can it be said I am alone

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: When all the world is here to look on me?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I'll run from thee, and hide me in the brakes,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And leave thee to the mercy of wild beasts.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The wildest hath not such a heart as you.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Run when you will, the story shall be chang'd;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Apollo flies, and Daphne holds the chase;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The dove pursues the griffin; the mild hind

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Makes speed to catch the tiger,--bootless speed,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: When cowardice pursues and valour flies.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I will not stay thy questions; let me go:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Or, if thou follow me, do not believe

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But I shall do thee mischief in the wood.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Ay, in the temple, in the town, the field,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You do me mischief. Fie, Demetrius!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Your wrongs do set a scandal on my sex:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: We cannot fight for love as men may do:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: We should be woo'd, and were not made to woo.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I'll follow thee, and make a heaven of hell,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To die upon the hand I love so well.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exeunt DEMETRIUS and HELENA.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Fare thee well, nymph: ere he do leave this grove,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thou shalt fly him, and he shall seek thy love.--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Re-enter PUCK.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Hast thou the flower there? Welcome, wanderer.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Ay, there it is.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I pray thee give it me.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I know a bank whereon the wild thyme blows,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Where ox-lips and the nodding violet grows;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Quite over-canopied with luscious woodbine,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: With sweet musk-roses, and with eglantine:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: There sleeps Titania sometime of the night,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Lulled in these flowers with dances and delight;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And there the snake throws her enamell'd skin,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Weed wide enough to wrap a fairy in:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And with the juice of this I'll streak her eyes,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And make her full of hateful fantasies.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Take thou some of it, and seek through this grove:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: A sweet Athenian lady is in love

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: With a disdainful youth: anoint his eyes;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But do it when the next thing he espies

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: May be the lady: thou shalt know the man

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: By the Athenian garments he hath on.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Effect it with some care, that he may prove

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: More fond on her than she upon her love:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And look thou meet me ere the first cock crow.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Fear not, my lord; your servant shall do so.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exeunt.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: SCENE II. Another part of the wood.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter TITANIA, with her Train.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: TITANIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Come, now a roundel and a fairy song;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Then, for the third part of a minute, hence;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Some to kill cankers in the musk-rose buds;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Some war with rere-mice for their leathern wings,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To make my small elves coats; and some keep back

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The clamorous owl, that nightly hoots and wonders

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: At our quaint spirits. Sing me now asleep;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Then to your offices, and let me rest.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: SONG.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: FIRST FAIRY

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You spotted snakes, with double tongue,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thorny hedgehogs, be not seen;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Newts and blind-worms do no wrong;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Come not near our fairy queen:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: CHORUS.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Philomel, with melody,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Sing in our sweet lullaby:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Lulla, lulla, lullaby; lulla, lulla, lullaby:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Never harm, nor spell, nor charm,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Come our lovely lady nigh;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: So good-night, with lullaby.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: II.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: SECOND FAIRY

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Weaving spiders, come not here;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Hence, you long-legg'd spinners, hence;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Beetles black, approach not near;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Worm nor snail do no offence.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: CHORUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Philomel with melody, &c.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: FIRST FAIRY

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Hence away; now all is well.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: One, aloof, stand sentinel.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exeunt Fairies. TITANIA sleeps.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter OBERON.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What thou seest when thou dost wake,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Squeezes the flower on TITANIA'S eyelids.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Do it for thy true-love take;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Love and languish for his sake;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Be it ounce, or cat, or bear,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Pard, or boar with bristled hair,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: In thy eye that shall appear

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: When thou wak'st, it is thy dear;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Wake when some vile thing is near.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter LYSANDER and HERMIA.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Fair love, you faint with wandering in the wood;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And, to speak troth, I have forgot our way;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: We'll rest us, Hermia, if you think it good,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And tarry for the comfort of the day.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Be it so, Lysander: find you out a bed,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For I upon this bank will rest my head.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: One turf shall serve as pillow for us both;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: One heart, one bed, two bosoms, and one troth.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Nay, good Lysander; for my sake, my dear,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Lie farther off yet, do not lie so near.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O, take the sense, sweet, of my innocence;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Love takes the meaning in love's conference.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I mean that my heart unto yours is knit;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: So that but one heart we can make of it:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Two bosoms interchained with an oath;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: So then two bosoms and a single troth.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Then by your side no bed-room me deny;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For lying so, Hermia, I do not lie.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Lysander riddles very prettily:--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Now much beshrew my manners and my pride

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: If Hermia meant to say Lysander lied!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But, gentle friend, for love and courtesy

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Lie further off; in human modesty,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Such separation as may well be said

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Becomes a virtuous bachelor and a maid:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: So far be distant; and good night, sweet friend:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thy love ne'er alter till thy sweet life end!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Amen, amen, to that fair prayer say I;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And then end life when I end loyalty!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Here is my bed: Sleep give thee all his rest!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: With half that wish the wisher's eyes be pressed!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [They sleep.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter PUCK.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Through the forest have I gone,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But Athenian found I none,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: On whose eyes I might approve

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: This flower's force in stirring love.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Night and silence! Who is here?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Weeds of Athens he doth wear:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: This is he, my master said,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Despised the Athenian maid;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And here the maiden, sleeping sound,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: On the dank and dirty ground.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Pretty soul! she durst not lie

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Near this lack-love, this kill-courtesy.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Churl, upon thy eyes I throw

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: All the power this charm doth owe;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: When thou wak'st let love forbid

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Sleep his seat on thy eyelid:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: So awake when I am gone;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For I must now to Oberon.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter DEMETRIUS and HELENA, running.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Stay, though thou kill me, sweet Demetrius.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I charge thee, hence, and do not haunt me thus.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O, wilt thou darkling leave me? do not so.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Stay on thy peril; I alone will go.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit DEMETRIUS.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O, I am out of breath in this fond chase!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The more my prayer, the lesser is my grace.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Happy is Hermia, wheresoe'er she lies,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For she hath blessed and attractive eyes.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: How came her eyes so bright? Not with salt tears:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: If so, my eyes are oftener wash'd than hers.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: No, no, I am as ugly as a bear;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For beasts that meet me run away for fear:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Therefore no marvel though Demetrius

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Do, as a monster, fly my presence thus.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What wicked and dissembling glass of mine

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Made me compare with Hermia's sphery eyne?--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But who is here?--Lysander! on the ground!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Dead? or asleep? I see no blood, no wound.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Lysander, if you live, good sir, awake.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Waking.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And run through fire I will for thy sweet sake.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Transparent Helena! Nature shows art,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That through thy bosom makes me see thy heart.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Where is Demetrius? O, how fit a word

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Is that vile name to perish on my sword!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Do not say so, Lysander; say not so:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What though he love your Hermia? Lord, what though?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Yet Hermia still loves you: then be content.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Content with Hermia? No: I do repent

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The tedious minutes I with her have spent.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Not Hermia but Helena I love:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Who will not change a raven for a dove?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The will of man is by his reason sway'd;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And reason says you are the worthier maid.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Things growing are not ripe until their season;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: So I, being young, till now ripe not to reason;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And touching now the point of human skill,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Reason becomes the marshal to my will,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And leads me to your eyes, where I o'erlook

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Love's stories, written in love's richest book.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Wherefore was I to this keen mockery born?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: When at your hands did I deserve this scorn?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Is't not enough, is't not enough, young man,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That I did never, no, nor never can

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Deserve a sweet look from Demetrius' eye,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But you must flout my insufficiency?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Good troth, you do me wrong,--good sooth, you do--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: In such disdainful manner me to woo.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But fare you well: perforce I must confess,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I thought you lord of more true gentleness.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O, that a lady of one man refus'd

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Should of another therefore be abus'd!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: She sees not Hermia:--Hermia, sleep thou there;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And never mayst thou come Lysander near!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For, as a surfeit of the sweetest things

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The deepest loathing to the stomach brings;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Or, as the heresies that men do leave

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Are hated most of those they did deceive;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: So thou, my surfeit and my heresy,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Of all be hated, but the most of me!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And, all my powers, address your love and might

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To honour Helen, and to be her knight!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Starting.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Help me, Lysander, help me! do thy best

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To pluck this crawling serpent from my breast!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Ay me, for pity!--What a dream was here!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Lysander, look how I do quake with fear!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Methought a serpent eat my heart away,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And you sat smiling at his cruel prey.--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Lysander! what, removed? Lysander! lord!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What, out of hearing? gone? no sound, no word?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Alack, where are you? speak, an if you hear;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Speak, of all loves! I swoon almost with fear.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: No?--then I well perceive you are not nigh:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Either death or you I'll find immediately.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: ACT III.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: SCENE I. The Wood. The Queen of Fairies lying asleep.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter QUINCE, SNUG, BOTTOM, FLUTE, SNOUT, and STARVELING.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Are we all met?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: QUINCE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Pat, pat; and here's a marvellous convenient place for our

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: rehearsal. This green plot shall be our stage, this hawthorn

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: brake our tiring-house; and we will do it in action, as we will

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: do it before the duke.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Peter Quince,--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: QUINCE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What sayest thou, bully Bottom?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: There are things in this comedy of 'Pyramus and Thisby' that

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: will never please. First, Pyramus must draw a sword to kill

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: himself; which the ladies cannot abide. How answer you that?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: SNOUT

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: By'r lakin, a parlous fear.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: STARVELING

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I believe we must leave the killing out, when all is done.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Not a whit: I have a device to make all well. Write me a

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: prologue; and let the prologue seem to say we will do no harm

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: with our swords, and that Pyramus is not killed indeed; and for

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: the more better assurance, tell them that I Pyramus am not

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Pyramus but Bottom the weaver: this will put them out of fear.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: QUINCE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Well, we will have such a prologue; and it shall be

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: written in eight and six.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: No, make it two more; let it be written in eight and eight.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: SNOUT

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Will not the ladies be afeard of the lion?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: STARVELING

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I fear it, I promise you.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Masters, you ought to consider with yourselves: to bring in,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: God shield us! a lion among ladies is a most dreadful thing:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: for there is not a more fearful wild-fowl than your lion living;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: and we ought to look to it.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: SNOUT

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Therefore another prologue must tell he is not a lion.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Nay, you must name his name, and half his face must be seen

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: through the lion's neck; and he himself must speak through,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: saying thus, or to the same defect,--'Ladies,' or, 'Fair ladies, I

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: would wish you, or, I would request you, or, I would entreat you,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: not to fear, not to tremble: my life for yours. If you think I

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: come hither as a lion, it were pity of my life. No, I am no such

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: thing; I am a man as other men are:'--and there, indeed, let him

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: name his name, and tell them plainly he is Snug the joiner.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: QUINCE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Well, it shall be so. But there is two hard things; that

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: is, to bring the moonlight into a chamber: for, you know,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Pyramus and Thisbe meet by moonlight.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: SNOUT

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Doth the moon shine that night we play our play?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: A calendar, a calendar! look in the almanack; find out

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: moonshine, find out moonshine.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: QUINCE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Yes, it doth shine that night.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Why, then may you leave a casement of the great chamber-window,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: where we play, open; and the moon may shine in at the casement.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: QUINCE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Ay; or else one must come in with a bush of thorns and a

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: lantern, and say he comes to disfigure or to present the person

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: of moonshine. Then there is another thing: we must have a

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: wall in the great chamber; for Pyramus and Thisby, says the

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: story, did talk through the chink of a wall.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: SNOUT

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You can never bring in a wall.--What say you, Bottom?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Some man or other must present wall: and let him have

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: some plaster, or some loam, or some rough-cast about him, to

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: signify wall; and let him hold his fingers thus, and through that

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: cranny shall Pyramus and Thisby whisper.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: QUINCE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: If that may be, then all is well. Come, sit down, every

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: mother's son, and rehearse your parts. Pyramus, you begin:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: when you have spoken your speech, enter into that brake; and so

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: every one according to his cue.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter PUCK behind.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What hempen homespuns have we swaggering here,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: So near the cradle of the fairy queen?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What, a play toward! I'll be an auditor;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: An actor too perhaps, if I see cause.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: QUINCE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Speak, Pyramus.--Thisby, stand forth.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PYRAMUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: 'Thisby, the flowers of odious savours sweet,'

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: QUINCE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Odours, odours.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PYRAMUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: '--odours savours sweet:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: So hath thy breath, my dearest Thisby dear.--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But hark, a voice! stay thou but here awhile,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And by and by I will to thee appear.'

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: A stranger Pyramus than e'er played here!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Aside.--Exit.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THISBE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Must I speak now?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: QUINCE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Ay, marry, must you: for you must understand he goes

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: but to see a noise that he heard, and is to come again.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THISBE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: 'Most radiant Pyramus, most lily white of hue,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Of colour like the red rose on triumphant brier,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Most brisky juvenal, and eke most lovely Jew,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: As true as truest horse, that would never tire,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I'll meet thee, Pyramus, at Ninny's tomb.'

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: QUINCE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Ninus' tomb, man: why, you must not speak that yet:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: that you answer to Pyramus. You speak all your part at once,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: cues, and all.--Pyramus enter: your cue is past; it is 'never

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: tire.'

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Re-enter PUCK, and BOTTOM with an ass's head.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THISBE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O,'--As true as truest horse, that yet would never tire.'

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PYRAMUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: 'If I were fair, Thisby, I were only thine:--'

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: QUINCE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O monstrous! O strange! we are haunted. Pray, masters!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: fly, masters! Help!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exeunt Clowns.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I'll follow you; I'll lead you about a round,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Through bog, through bush, through brake, through brier;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Sometime a horse I'll be, sometime a hound,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: A hog, a headless bear, sometime a fire;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And neigh, and bark, and grunt, and roar, and burn,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Like horse, hound, hog, bear, fire, at every turn.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Why do they run away? This is a knavery of them to make

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: me afeard.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Re-enter SNOUT.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: SNOUT

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O Bottom, thou art changed! What do I see on thee?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What do you see? you see an ass-head of your own, do you?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Re-enter QUINCE.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: QUINCE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Bless thee, Bottom! bless thee! thou art translated.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I see their knavery: this is to make an ass of me; to

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: fright me, if they could. But I will not stir from this

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: place, do what they can: I will walk up and down here,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: and I will sing, that they shall hear I am not afraid.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Sings.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The ousel cock, so black of hue,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: With orange-tawny bill,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The throstle with his note so true,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The wren with little quill.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: TITANIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Waking.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What angel wakes me from my flowery bed?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Sings.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The finch, the sparrow, and the lark,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The plain-song cuckoo gray,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Whose note full many a man doth mark,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And dares not answer nay;--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: for, indeed, who would set his wit to so foolish a bird?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Who would give a bird the lie, though he cry 'cuckoo' never so?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: TITANIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I pray thee, gentle mortal, sing again;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Mine ear is much enamour'd of thy note.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: So is mine eye enthralled to thy shape;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And thy fair virtue's force perforce doth move me,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: On the first view, to say, to swear, I love thee.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Methinks, mistress, you should have little reason for

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: that: and yet, to say the truth, reason and love keep little

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: company together now-a-days: the more the pity that some honest

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: neighbours will not make them friends. Nay, I can gleek upon

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: occasion.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: TITANIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thou art as wise as thou art beautiful.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Not so, neither: but if I had wit enough to get out of

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: this wood, I have enough to serve mine own turn.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: TITANIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Out of this wood do not desire to go;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thou shalt remain here whether thou wilt or no.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I am a spirit of no common rate,--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The summer still doth tend upon my state;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And I do love thee: therefore, go with me,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I'll give thee fairies to attend on thee;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And they shall fetch thee jewels from the deep,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And sing, while thou on pressed flowers dost sleep:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And I will purge thy mortal grossness so

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That thou shalt like an airy spirit go.--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Peasblossom! Cobweb! Moth! and Mustardseed!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter Four Fairies.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: FIRST FAIRY

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Ready.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: SECOND FAIRY

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And I.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THIRD FAIRY

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And I.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: FOURTH FAIRY

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Where shall we go?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: TITANIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Be kind and courteous to this gentleman;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Hop in his walks and gambol in his eyes;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Feed him with apricocks and dewberries,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: With purple grapes, green figs, and mulberries;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The honey bags steal from the humble-bees,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And, for night-tapers, crop their waxen thighs,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And light them at the fiery glow-worm's eyes,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To have my love to bed and to arise;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And pluck the wings from painted butterflies,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To fan the moonbeams from his sleeping eyes:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Nod to him, elves, and do him courtesies.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: FIRST FAIRY

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Hail, mortal!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: SECOND FAIRY

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Hail!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THIRD FAIRY

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Hail!

text: FOURTH FAIRY

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Hail!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I cry your worships mercy, heartily.--I beseech your

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: worship's name.
