text: COBWEB

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Cobweb.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I shall desire you of more acquaintance, good Master Cobweb. If I

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: cut my finger, I shall make bold with you.--Your name, honest

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: gentleman?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PEASBLOSSOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Peasblossom.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I pray you, commend me to Mistress Squash, your mother, and

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: to Master Peascod, your father. Good Master Peasblossom, I

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: shall desire you of more acquaintance too.--Your name, I beseech

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: you, sir?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: MUSTARDSEED

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Mustardseed.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Good Master Mustardseed, I know your patience well:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That same cowardly giant-like ox-beef hath devoured many a

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: gentleman of your house: I promise you your kindred hath made my

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: eyes water ere now. I desire you of more acquaintance, good

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Master Mustardseed.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: TITANIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Come, wait upon him; lead him to my bower.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The moon, methinks, looks with a watery eye;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And when she weeps, weeps every little flower;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Lamenting some enforcèd chastity.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Tie up my love's tongue, bring him silently.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exeunt.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: SCENE II. Another part of the wood.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter OBERON.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I wonder if Titania be awak'd;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Then, what it was that next came in her eye,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Which she must dote on in extremity.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter PUCK.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Here comes my messenger.--How now, mad spirit?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What night-rule now about this haunted grove?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: My mistress with a monster is in love.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Near to her close and consecrated bower,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: While she was in her dull and sleeping hour,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: A crew of patches, rude mechanicals,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That work for bread upon Athenian stalls,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Were met together to rehearse a play

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Intended for great Theseus' nuptial day.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The shallowest thickskin of that barren sort

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Who Pyramus presented in their sport,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Forsook his scene and enter'd in a brake;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: When I did him at this advantage take,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: An ass's nowl I fixèd on his head;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Anon, his Thisbe must be answered,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And forth my mimic comes. When they him spy,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: As wild geese that the creeping fowler eye,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Or russet-pated choughs, many in sort,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Rising and cawing at the gun's report,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Sever themselves and madly sweep the sky,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: So at his sight away his fellows fly:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And at our stamp here, o'er and o'er one falls;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: He murder cries, and help from Athens calls.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Their sense thus weak, lost with their fears, thus strong,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Made senseless things begin to do them wrong;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For briers and thorns at their apparel snatch;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Some sleeves, some hats: from yielders all things catch.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I led them on in this distracted fear,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And left sweet Pyramus translated there:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: When in that moment,--so it came to pass,--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Titania wak'd, and straightway lov'd an ass.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: This falls out better than I could devise.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But hast thou yet latch'd the Athenian's eyes

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: With the love-juice, as I did bid thee do?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I took him sleeping,--that is finish'd too,--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And the Athenian woman by his side;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That, when he wak'd, of force she must be ey'd.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter DEMETRIUS and HERMIA.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Stand close; this is the same Athenian.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: This is the woman, but not this the man.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O, why rebuke you him that loves you so?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Lay breath so bitter on your bitter foe.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Now I but chide, but I should use thee worse;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For thou, I fear, hast given me cause to curse.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: If thou hast slain Lysander in his sleep,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Being o'er shoes in blood, plunge in the deep,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And kill me too.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The sun was not so true unto the day

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: As he to me: would he have stol'n away

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: From sleeping Hermia? I'll believe as soon

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: This whole earth may be bor'd; and that the moon

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: May through the centre creep and so displease

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Her brother's noontide with the antipodes.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: It cannot be but thou hast murder'd him;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: So should a murderer look; so dead, so grim.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: So should the murder'd look; and so should I,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Pierc'd through the heart with your stern cruelty:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Yet you, the murderer, look as bright, as clear,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: As yonder Venus in her glimmering sphere.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What's this to my Lysander? where is he?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Ah, good Demetrius, wilt thou give him me?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I had rather give his carcass to my hounds.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Out, dog! out, cur! thou driv'st me past the bounds

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Of maiden's patience. Hast thou slain him, then?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Henceforth be never number'd among men!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Oh! once tell true; tell true, even for my sake;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Durst thou have look'd upon him, being awake,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And hast thou kill'd him sleeping? O brave touch!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Could not a worm, an adder, do so much?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: An adder did it; for with doubler tongue

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Than thine, thou serpent, never adder stung.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You spend your passion on a mispris'd mood:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I am not guilty of Lysander's blood;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Nor is he dead, for aught that I can tell.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I pray thee, tell me, then, that he is well.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: An if I could, what should I get therefore?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: A privilege never to see me more.--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And from thy hated presence part I so:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: See me no more whether he be dead or no.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: There is no following her in this fierce vein:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Here, therefore, for a while I will remain.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: So sorrow's heaviness doth heavier grow

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For debt that bankrupt sleep doth sorrow owe;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Which now in some slight measure it will pay,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: If for his tender here I make some stay.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Lies down.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What hast thou done? thou hast mistaken quite,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And laid the love-juice on some true-love's sight:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Of thy misprision must perforce ensue

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Some true love turn'd, and not a false turn'd true.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Then fate o'er-rules, that, one man holding troth,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: A million fail, confounding oath on oath.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: About the wood go, swifter than the wind,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And Helena of Athens look thou find:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: All fancy-sick she is, and pale of cheer,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: With sighs of love, that costs the fresh blood dear.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: By some illusion see thou bring her here;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I'll charm his eyes against she do appear.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I go, I go; look how I go,--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Swifter than arrow from the Tartar's bow.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Flower of this purple dye,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Hit with Cupid's archery,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Sink in apple of his eye!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: When his love he doth espy,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Let her shine as gloriously

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: As the Venus of the sky.--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: When thou wak'st, if she be by,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Beg of her for remedy.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Re-enter PUCK.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Captain of our fairy band,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Helena is here at hand,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And the youth mistook by me

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Pleading for a lover's fee;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Shall we their fond pageant see?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Lord, what fools these mortals be!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Stand aside: the noise they make

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Will cause Demetrius to awake.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Then will two at once woo one,--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That must needs be sport alone;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And those things do best please me

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That befall preposterously.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter LYSANDER and HELENA.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Why should you think that I should woo in scorn?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Scorn and derision never come in tears.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Look when I vow, I weep; and vows so born,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: In their nativity all truth appears.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: How can these things in me seem scorn to you,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Bearing the badge of faith, to prove them true?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You do advance your cunning more and more.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: When truth kills truth, O devilish-holy fray!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: These vows are Hermia's: will you give her o'er?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Weigh oath with oath, and you will nothing weigh:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Your vows to her and me, put in two scales,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Will even weigh; and both as light as tales.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I had no judgment when to her I swore.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Nor none, in my mind, now you give her o'er.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Demetrius loves her, and he loves not you.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Awaking.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O Helen, goddess, nymph, perfect, divine!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To what, my love, shall I compare thine eyne?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Crystal is muddy. O, how ripe in show

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thy lips, those kissing cherries, tempting grow!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That pure congealed white, high Taurus' snow,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Fann'd with the eastern wind, turns to a crow

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: When thou hold'st up thy hand: O, let me kiss

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: This princess of pure white, this seal of bliss!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O spite! O hell! I see you all are bent

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To set against me for your merriment.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: If you were civil, and knew courtesy,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You would not do me thus much injury.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Can you not hate me, as I know you do,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But you must join in souls to mock me too?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: If you were men, as men you are in show,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You would not use a gentle lady so;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To vow, and swear, and superpraise my parts,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: When I am sure you hate me with your hearts.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You both are rivals, and love Hermia;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And now both rivals, to mock Helena:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: A trim exploit, a manly enterprise,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To conjure tears up in a poor maid's eyes

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: With your derision! None of noble sort

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Would so offend a virgin, and extort

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: A poor soul's patience, all to make you sport.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You are unkind, Demetrius; be not so;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For you love Hermia: this you know I know:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And here, with all good will, with all my heart,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: In Hermia's love I yield you up my part;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And yours of Helena to me bequeath,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Whom I do love and will do till my death.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Never did mockers waste more idle breath.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Lysander, keep thy Hermia; I will none:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: If e'er I lov'd her, all that love is gone.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: My heart to her but as guest-wise sojourn'd;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And now to Helen is it home return'd,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: There to remain.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Helen, it is not so.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Disparage not the faith thou dost not know,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Lest, to thy peril, thou aby it dear.--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Look where thy love comes; yonder is thy dear.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter HERMIA.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Dark night, that from the eye his function takes,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The ear more quick of apprehension makes;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Wherein it doth impair the seeing sense,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: It pays the hearing double recompense:--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thou art not by mine eye, Lysander, found;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Mine ear, I thank it, brought me to thy sound.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But why unkindly didst thou leave me so?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Why should he stay whom love doth press to go?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What love could press Lysander from my side?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Lysander's love, that would not let him bide,--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Fair Helena,--who more engilds the night

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Than all yon fiery oes and eyes of light.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Why seek'st thou me? could not this make thee know

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The hate I bare thee made me leave thee so?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You speak not as you think; it cannot be.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Lo, she is one of this confederacy!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Now I perceive they have conjoin'd all three

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To fashion this false sport in spite of me.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Injurious Hermia! most ungrateful maid!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Have you conspir'd, have you with these contriv'd,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To bait me with this foul derision?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Is all the counsel that we two have shar'd,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The sisters' vows, the hours that we have spent,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: When we have chid the hasty-footed time

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For parting us,--O, is all forgot?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: All school-days' friendship, childhood innocence?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: We, Hermia, like two artificial gods,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Have with our needles created both one flower,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Both on one sampler, sitting on one cushion,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Both warbling of one song, both in one key;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: As if our hands, our sides, voices, and minds,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Had been incorporate. So we grew together,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Like to a double cherry, seeming parted;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But yet a union in partition,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Two lovely berries moulded on one stem:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: So, with two seeming bodies, but one heart;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Two of the first, like coats in heraldry,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Due but to one, and crowned with one crest.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And will you rent our ancient love asunder,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To join with men in scorning your poor friend?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: It is not friendly, 'tis not maidenly:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Our sex, as well as I, may chide you for it,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Though I alone do feel the injury.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I am amazed at your passionate words:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I scorn you not; it seems that you scorn me.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Have you not set Lysander, as in scorn,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To follow me, and praise my eyes and face?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And made your other love, Demetrius,--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Who even but now did spurn me with his foot,--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To call me goddess, nymph, divine, and rare,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Precious, celestial? Wherefore speaks he this

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To her he hates? and wherefore doth Lysander

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Deny your love, so rich within his soul,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And tender me, forsooth, affection,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But by your setting on, by your consent?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What though I be not so in grace as you,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: So hung upon with love, so fortunate;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But miserable most, to love unlov'd?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: This you should pity rather than despise.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I understand not what you mean by this.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Ay, do persever, counterfeit sad looks,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Make mows upon me when I turn my back;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Wink each at other; hold the sweet jest up:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: This sport, well carried, shall be chronicled.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: If you have any pity, grace, or manners,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You would not make me such an argument.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But fare ye well: 'tis partly my own fault;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Which death, or absence, soon shall remedy.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Stay, gentle Helena; hear my excuse;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: My love, my life, my soul, fair Helena!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O excellent!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Sweet, do not scorn her so.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: If she cannot entreat, I can compel.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thou canst compel no more than she entreat;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thy threats have no more strength than her weak prayers.--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Helen, I love thee; by my life I do;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I swear by that which I will lose for thee

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To prove him false that says I love thee not.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I say I love thee more than he can do.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: If thou say so, withdraw, and prove it too.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Quick, come,--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Lysander, whereto tends all this?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Away, you Ethiope!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: No, no, sir:--he will

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Seem to break loose; take on as you would follow:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But yet come not. You are a tame man; go!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Hang off, thou cat, thou burr: vile thing, let loose,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Or I will shake thee from me like a serpent.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Why are you grown so rude? what change is this,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Sweet love?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thy love! out, tawny Tartar, out!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Out, loathed medicine! hated potion, hence!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Do you not jest?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Yes, sooth; and so do you.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Demetrius, I will keep my word with thee.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I would I had your bond; for I perceive

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: A weak bond holds you; I'll not trust your word.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What! should I hurt her, strike her, kill her dead?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Although I hate her, I'll not harm her so.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What! can you do me greater harm than hate?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Hate me! wherefore? O me! what news, my love?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Am not I Hermia? Are not you Lysander?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I am as fair now as I was erewhile.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Since night you lov'd me; yet since night you left me:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Why then, you left me,--O, the gods forbid!--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: In earnest, shall I say?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Ay, by my life;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And never did desire to see thee more.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Therefore be out of hope, of question, doubt,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Be certain, nothing truer; 'tis no jest

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That I do hate thee and love Helena.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O me! you juggler! you cankerblossom!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You thief of love! What! have you come by night,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And stol'n my love's heart from him?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Fine, i' faith!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Have you no modesty, no maiden shame,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: No touch of bashfulness? What! will you tear

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Impatient answers from my gentle tongue?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Fie, fie! you counterfeit, you puppet, you!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Puppet! why so? Ay, that way goes the game.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Now I perceive that she hath made compare

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Between our statures; she hath urg'd her height;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And with her personage, her tall personage,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Her height, forsooth, she hath prevail'd with him.--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And are you grown so high in his esteem

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Because I am so dwarfish and so low?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: How low am I, thou painted maypole? speak;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: How low am I? I am not yet so low

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But that my nails can reach unto thine eyes.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I pray you, though you mock me, gentlemen,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Let her not hurt me. I was never curst;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I have no gift at all in shrewishness;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I am a right maid for my cowardice;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Let her not strike me. You perhaps may think,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Because she is something lower than myself,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That I can match her.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Lower! hark, again.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Good Hermia, do not be so bitter with me.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I evermore did love you, Hermia;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Did ever keep your counsels; never wrong'd you;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Save that, in love unto Demetrius,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I told him of your stealth unto this wood:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: He follow'd you; for love I follow'd him;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But he hath chid me hence, and threaten'd me

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To strike me, spurn me, nay, to kill me too:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And now, so you will let me quiet go,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To Athens will I bear my folly back,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And follow you no farther. Let me go:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You see how simple and how fond I am.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Why, get you gone: who is't that hinders you?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: A foolish heart that I leave here behind.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What! with Lysander?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: With Demetrius.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Be not afraid; she shall not harm thee, Helena.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: No, sir, she shall not, though you take her part.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O, when she's angry, she is keen and shrewd:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: She was a vixen when she went to school;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And, though she be but little, she is fierce.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Little again! nothing but low and little!--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Why will you suffer her to flout me thus?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Let me come to her.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Get you gone, you dwarf;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You minimus, of hind'ring knot-grass made;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You bead, you acorn.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You are too officious

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: In her behalf that scorns your services.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Let her alone: speak not of Helena;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Take not her part; for if thou dost intend

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Never so little show of love to her,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thou shalt aby it.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Now she holds me not;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Now follow, if thou dar'st, to try whose right,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Of thine or mine, is most in Helena.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Follow! nay, I'll go with thee, cheek by jole.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exeunt LYSANDER and DEMETRIUS.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You, mistress, all this coil is 'long of you:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Nay, go not back.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I will not trust you, I;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Nor longer stay in your curst company.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Your hands than mine are quicker for a fray;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: My legs are longer though, to run away.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I am amaz'd, and know not what to say.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit, pursuing HELENA.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: This is thy negligence: still thou mistak'st,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Or else commit'st thy knaveries willfully.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Believe me, king of shadows, I mistook.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Did not you tell me I should know the man

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: By the Athenian garments he had on?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And so far blameless proves my enterprise

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That I have 'nointed an Athenian's eyes:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And so far am I glad it so did sort,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: As this their jangling I esteem a sport.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thou seest these lovers seek a place to fight;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Hie therefore, Robin, overcast the night;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The starry welkin cover thou anon

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: With drooping fog, as black as Acheron,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And lead these testy rivals so astray

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: As one come not within another's way.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Like to Lysander sometime frame thy tongue,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Then stir Demetrius up with bitter wrong;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And sometime rail thou like Demetrius;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And from each other look thou lead them thus,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Till o'er their brows death-counterfeiting sleep

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: With leaden legs and batty wings doth creep:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Then crush this herb into Lysander's eye;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Whose liquor hath this virtuous property,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To take from thence all error with his might

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And make his eyeballs roll with wonted sight.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: When they next wake, all this derision

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Shall seem a dream and fruitless vision;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And back to Athens shall the lovers wend

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: With league whose date till death shall never end.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Whiles I in this affair do thee employ,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I'll to my queen, and beg her Indian boy;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And then I will her charmed eye release

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: From monster's view, and all things shall be peace.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: My fairy lord, this must be done with haste,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For night's swift dragons cut the clouds full fast;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And yonder shines Aurora's harbinger,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: At whose approach ghosts, wandering here and there,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Troop home to churchyards: damned spirits all,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That in cross-ways and floods have burial,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Already to their wormy beds are gone;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For fear lest day should look their shames upon

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: They wilfully exile themselves from light,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And must for aye consort with black-brow'd night.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But we are spirits of another sort:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I with the morning's love have oft made sport;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And, like a forester, the groves may tread

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Even till the eastern gate, all fiery-red,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Opening on Neptune with fair blessed beams,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Turns into yellow gold his salt-green streams.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But, notwithstanding, haste; make no delay:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: We may effect this business yet ere day.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit OBERON.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Up and down, up and down;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I will lead them up and down:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I am fear'd in field and town.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Goblin, lead them up and down.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Here comes one.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter LYSANDER.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Where art thou, proud Demetrius? speak thou now.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Here, villain; drawn and ready. Where art thou?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I will be with thee straight.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Follow me, then,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To plainer ground.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit LYSANDER as following the voice.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter DEMETRIUS.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Lysander! speak again.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thou runaway, thou coward, art thou fled?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Speak. In some bush? where dost thou hide thy head?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thou coward, art thou bragging to the stars,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Telling the bushes that thou look'st for wars,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And wilt not come? Come, recreant; come, thou child;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I'll whip thee with a rod: he is defiled

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That draws a sword on thee.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Yea, art thou there?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Follow my voice; we'll try no manhood here.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exeunt.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Re-enter LYSANDER.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: He goes before me, and still dares me on;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: When I come where he calls, then he is gone.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The villain is much lighter heeled than I:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I follow'd fast, but faster he did fly;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That fallen am I in dark uneven way,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And here will rest me.  Come, thou gentle day!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Lies down.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For if but once thou show me thy grey light,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I'll find Demetrius, and revenge this spite.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Sleeps.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Re-enter PUCK and DEMETRIUS.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Ho, ho, ho, ho! Coward, why com'st thou not?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Abide me, if thou dar'st; for well I wot

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thou runn'st before me, shifting every place;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And dar'st not stand, nor look me in the face.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Where art thou?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Come hither; I am here.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Nay, then, thou mock'st me.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thou shalt buy this dear,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: If ever I thy face by daylight see:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Now, go thy way. Faintness constraineth me

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To measure out my length on this cold bed.--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: By day's approach look to be visited.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Lies down and sleeps.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter HELENA.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HELENA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O weary night, O long and tedious night,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Abate thy hours! Shine comforts from the east,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That I may back to Athens by daylight,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: From these that my poor company detest:--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And sleep, that sometimes shuts up sorrow's eye,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Steal me awhile from mine own company.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Sleeps.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Yet but three? Come one more;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Two of both kinds makes up four.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Here she comes, curst and sad:--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Cupid is a knavish lad,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thus to make poor females mad.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter HERMIA.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HERMIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Never so weary, never so in woe,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Bedabbled with the dew, and torn with briers;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I can no further crawl, no further go;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: My legs can keep no pace with my desires.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Here will I rest me till the break of day.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Heavens shield Lysander, if they mean a fray!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Lies down.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: On the ground

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Sleep sound:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I'll apply

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To your eye,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Gentle lover, remedy.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Squeezing the juice on LYSANDER'S eye.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: When thou wak'st,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thou tak'st

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: True delight

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: In the sight

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Of thy former lady's eye:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And the country proverb known,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That every man should take his own,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: In your waking shall be shown:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Jack shall have Jill;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Nought shall go ill;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The man shall have his mare again, and all shall be well.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit PUCK.--DEMETRIUS, HELENA &c, sleep.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: ACT IV

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: SCENE I. The Wood.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter TITANIA and BOTTOM; PEASBLOSSOM, COBWEB, MOTH,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: MUSTARDSEED, and other FAIRIES attending; OBERON behind, unseen.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: TITANIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Come, sit thee down upon this flowery bed,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: While I thy amiable cheeks do coy,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And stick musk-roses in thy sleek smooth head,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And kiss thy fair large ears, my gentle joy.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Where's Peasblossom?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PEASBLOSSOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Ready.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Scratch my head, Peasblossom.--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Where's Monsieur Cobweb?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: COBWEB

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Ready.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Monsieur Cobweb; good monsieur, get you your weapons in

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: your hand and kill me a red-hipped humble-bee on the top of a

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: thistle; and, good monsieur, bring me the honey-bag. Do not

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: fret yourself too much in the action, monsieur; and, good

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: monsieur, have a care the honey-bag break not; I would be

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: loath to have you overflown with a honey-bag, signior.--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Where's Monsieur Mustardseed?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: MUSTARDSEED

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Ready.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Give me your neif, Monsieur Mustardseed.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Pray you, leave your curtsy, good monsieur.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: MUSTARDSEED

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What's your will?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Nothing, good monsieur, but to help Cavalero Cobweb to

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: scratch. I must to the barber's, monsieur; for methinks I am

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: marvellous hairy about the face; and I am such a tender ass,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: if my hair do but tickle me I must scratch.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: TITANIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What, wilt thou hear some music, my sweet love?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I have a reasonable good ear in music; let us have the

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: tongs and the bones.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: TITANIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Or say, sweet love, what thou desirest to eat.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Truly, a peck of provender; I could munch your good dry

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: oats. Methinks I have a great desire to a bottle of hay: good

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: hay, sweet hay, hath no fellow.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: TITANIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I have a venturous fairy that shall seek

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The squirrel's hoard, and fetch thee new nuts.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: BOTTOM

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I had rather have a handful or two of dried peas. But,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I pray you, let none of your people stir me; I have an

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: exposition of sleep come upon me.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: TITANIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Sleep thou, and I will wind thee in my arms.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Fairies, be gone, and be all ways away.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: So doth the woodbine the sweet honeysuckle

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Gently entwist,--the female ivy so

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Enrings the barky fingers of the elm.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O, how I love thee! how I dote on thee!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [They sleep.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [OBERON advances. Enter PUCK.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Welcome, good Robin. Seest thou this sweet sight?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Her dotage now I do begin to pity.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For, meeting her of late behind the wood,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Seeking sweet favours for this hateful fool,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I did upbraid her and fall out with her:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For she his hairy temples then had rounded

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: With coronet of fresh and fragrant flowers;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And that same dew, which sometime on the buds

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Was wont to swell like round and orient pearls,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Stood now within the pretty flow'rets' eyes,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Like tears that did their own disgrace bewail.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: When I had, at my pleasure, taunted her,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And she, in mild terms, begg'd my patience,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I then did ask of her her changeling child;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Which straight she gave me, and her fairy sent

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To bear him to my bower in fairy-land.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And now I have the boy, I will undo

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: This hateful imperfection of her eyes.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And, gentle Puck, take this transformed scalp

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: From off the head of this Athenian swain,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That he awaking when the other do,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: May all to Athens back again repair,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And think no more of this night's accidents

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But as the fierce vexation of a dream.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But first I will release the fairy queen.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Be as thou wast wont to be;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Touching her eyes with an herb.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: See as thou was wont to see.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Dian's bud o'er Cupid's flower

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Hath such force and blessed power.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Now, my Titania; wake you, my sweet queen.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: TITANIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: My Oberon! what visions have I seen!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Methought I was enamour'd of an ass.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: There lies your love.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: TITANIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: How came these things to pass?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O, how mine eyes do loathe his visage now!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Silence awhile.--Robin, take off this head.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Titania, music call; and strike more dead

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Than common sleep, of all these five, the sense.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: TITANIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Music, ho! music; such as charmeth sleep.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Now when thou wak'st, with thine own fool's eyes peep.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Sound, music. [Still music.] Come, my queen, take hands with me,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And rock the ground whereon these sleepers be.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Now thou and I are new in amity,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And will to-morrow midnight solemnly

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Dance in Duke Theseus' house triumphantly,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And bless it to all fair prosperity:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: There shall the pairs of faithful lovers be

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Wedded, with Theseus, all in jollity.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PUCK

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Fairy king, attend and mark;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I do hear the morning lark.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: OBERON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Then, my queen, in silence sad,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Trip we after night's shade.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: We the globe can compass soon,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Swifter than the wand'ring moon.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: TITANIA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Come, my lord; and in our flight,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Tell me how it came this night

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That I sleeping here was found

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: With these mortals on the ground.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exeunt. Horns sound within.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter THESEUS, HIPPOLYTA, EGEUS, and Train.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THESEUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Go, one of you, find out the forester;--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For now our observation is perform'd;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And since we have the vaward of the day,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: My love shall hear the music of my hounds,--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Uncouple in the western valley; go:--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Despatch, I say, and find the forester.--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit an ATTENDANT.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: We will, fair queen, up to the mountain's top,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And mark the musical confusion

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Of hounds and echo in conjunction.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HIPPOLYTA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I was with Hercules and Cadmus once

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: When in a wood of Crete they bay'd the bear

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: With hounds of Sparta: never did I hear

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Such gallant chiding; for, besides the groves,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The skies, the fountains, every region near

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Seem'd all one mutual cry: I never heard

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: So musical a discord, such sweet thunder.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THESEUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: My hounds are bred out of the Spartan kind,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: So flew'd, so sanded; and their heads are hung

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: With ears that sweep away the morning dew;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Crook-knee'd and dew-lap'd like Thessalian bulls;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Slow in pursuit, but match'd in mouth like bells,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Each under each. A cry more tuneable

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Was never holla'd to, nor cheer'd with horn,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: In Crete, in Sparta, nor in Thessaly.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Judge when you hear.--But, soft, what nymphs are these?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: EGEUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: My lord, this is my daughter here asleep;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And this Lysander; this Demetrius is;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: This Helena, old Nedar's Helena:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I wonder of their being here together.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THESEUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: No doubt they rose up early to observe

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The rite of May; and, hearing our intent,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Came here in grace of our solemnity.--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream

text: stol'n hence, and left me asleep! I have had a most rare

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: what. Methought I was, and methought I had,--but man is but a

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: patched fool, if he will offer to say what methought I had. The

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: eye of man hath not heard, the ear of man hath not seen; man's

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: gracious, I shall sing it at her death.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exit.]

text: The trusty Thisby, coming first by night,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Did scare away, or rather did affright;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And as she fled, her mantle she did fall;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Which Lion vile with bloody mouth did stain:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Anon comes Pyramus, sweet youth, and tall,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And finds his trusty Thisby's mantle slain;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Whereat with blade, with bloody blameful blade,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: He bravely broach'd his boiling bloody breast;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And Thisby, tarrying in mulberry shade,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: His dagger drew, and died. For all the rest,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Let Lion, Moonshine, Wall, and lovers twain,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: At large discourse while here they do remain.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exeunt PROLOGUE, THISBE, LION, and MOONSHINE.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THESEUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I wonder if the lion be to speak.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: No wonder, my lord: one lion may, when many asses do.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: WALL

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: In this same interlude it doth befall

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That I, one Snout by name, present a wall:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And such a wall as I would have you think

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That had in it a crannied hole or chink,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Through which the lovers, Pyramus and Thisby,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Did whisper often very secretly.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: This loam, this rough-cast, and this stone, doth show

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That I am that same wall; the truth is so:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And this the cranny is, right and sinister,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Through which the fearful lovers are to whisper.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THESEUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Would you desire lime and hair to speak better?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: It is the wittiest partition that ever I heard

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: discourse, my lord.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THESEUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Pyramus draws near the wall; silence.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter PYRAMUS.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PYRAMUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O grim-look'd night! O night with hue so black!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O night, which ever art when day is not!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O night, O night, alack, alack, alack,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I fear my Thisby's promise is forgot!--

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And thou, O wall, O sweet, O lovely wall,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That stand'st between her father's ground and mine;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thou wall, O wall, O sweet and lovely wall,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Show me thy chink, to blink through with mine eyne.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [WALL holds up his fingers.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thanks, courteous wall: Jove shield thee well for this!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But what see what see I? No Thisby do I see.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O wicked wall, through whom I see no bliss,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Curs'd be thy stones for thus deceiving me!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THESEUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The wall, methinks, being sensible, should curse again.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PYRAMUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: No, in truth, sir, he should not. 'Deceiving me' is

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thisby's cue: she is to enter now, and I am to spy her through

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: the wall. You shall see it will fall pat as I told you.--Yonder

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: she comes.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter THISBE.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THISBE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O wall, full often hast thou heard my moans,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For parting my fair Pyramus and me:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: My cherry lips have often kiss'd thy stones:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thy stones with lime and hair knit up in thee.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PYRAMUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I see a voice; now will I to the chink,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: To spy an I can hear my Thisby's face.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thisby!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THISBE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: My love! thou art my love, I think.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PYRAMUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Think what thou wilt, I am thy lover's grace;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And like Limander am I trusty still.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THISBE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And I like Helen, till the fates me kill.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PYRAMUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Not Shafalus to Procrus was so true.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THISBE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: As Shafalus to Procrus, I to you.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PYRAMUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O, kiss me through the hole of this vile wall.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THISBE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I kiss the wall's hole, not your lips at all.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PYRAMUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Wilt thou at Ninny's tomb meet me straightway?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THISBE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: 'Tide life, 'tide death, I come without delay.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: WALL

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thus have I, wall, my part discharged so;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: And, being done, thus Wall away doth go.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Exeunt WALL, PYRAMUS and THISBE.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THESEUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Now is the mural down between the two neighbours.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: No remedy, my lord, when walls are so wilful to hear

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: without warning.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HIPPOLYTA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: This is the silliest stuff that ever I heard.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THESEUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The best in this kind are but shadows; and the worst

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: are no worse, if imagination amend them.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HIPPOLYTA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: It must be your imagination then, and not theirs.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THESEUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: If we imagine no worse of them than they of

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: themselves, they may pass for excellent men.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Here come two noble beasts in, a moon and a lion.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter LION and MOONSHINE.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LION

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: You, ladies, you, whose gentle hearts do fear

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The smallest monstrous mouse that creeps on floor,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: May now, perchance, both quake and tremble here,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: When lion rough in wildest rage doth roar.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Then know that I, one Snug the joiner, am

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: A lion fell, nor else no lion's dam:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: For, if I should as lion come in strife

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Into this place, 'twere pity on my life.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THESEUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: A very gentle beast, and of a good conscience.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The very best at a beast, my lord, that e'er I saw.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: This lion is a very fox for his valour.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THESEUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: True; and a goose for his discretion.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Not so, my lord; for his valour cannot carry his

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: discretion, and the fox carries the goose.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THESEUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: His discretion, I am sure, cannot carry his valour;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: for the goose carries not the fox. It is well; leave it to his

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: discretion, and let us listen to the moon.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: MOONSHINE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: This lanthorn doth the horned moon present:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: He should have worn the horns on his head.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THESEUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: He is no crescent, and his horns are invisible within

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: the circumference.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: MOONSHINE

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: This lanthorn doth the horned moon present;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Myself the man i' the moon do seem to be.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: THESEUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: This is the greatest error of all the rest: the man should be

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: put into the lantern. How is it else the man i' the moon?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: He dares not come there for the candle: for, you

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: see, it is already in snuff.

text: HIPPOLYTA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: I am aweary of this moon: would he would change!

text: THESEUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: It appears, by his small light of discretion, that he

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: is in the wane: but yet, in courtesy, in all reason, we must

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: stay the time.

text: Proceed, moon.

text: MOON

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: All that I have to say, is to tell you that the lantern

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: is the moon; I, the man i' the moon; this thorn-bush, my

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: thorn-bush; and this dog, my dog.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Why, all these should be in the lantern; for all

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream

text: [Enter THISBE.]

text: THISBE

text: LION

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Oh!

text: THESEUS

text: Well moused, lion.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: DEMETRIUS

text: And so comes Pyramus.

text: LYSANDER

text: [Enter PYRAMUS.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: PYRAMUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Sweet moon, I thank thee for thy sunny beams;

text: I thank thee, moon, for shining now so bright:

text: For, by thy gracious golden, glittering streams,

text: I trust to take of truest Thisby's sight.

text: But stay;--O spite!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: But mark,--poor knight,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What dreadful dole is here!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Eyes, do you see?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: How can it be?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O dainty duck! O dear!

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Thy mantle good,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: What! stained with blood?

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Approach, ye furies fell!

text: O fates! come, come;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Cut thread and thrum;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Quail, rush, conclude, and quell!

text: THESEUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: This passion, and the death of a dear friend, would go

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: near to make a man look sad.

text: HIPPOLYTA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Beshrew my heart, but I pity the man.

text: PYRAMUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: O wherefore, nature, didst thou lions frame?

text: Since lion vile hath here deflower'd my dear;

text: Which is--no, no--which was the fairest dame

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: That liv'd, that lov'd, that lik'd, that look'd with cheer.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Come, tears, confound;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Out, sword, and wound

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: The pap of Pyramus:

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Ay, that left pap,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Where heart doth hop:--

text: Thus die I, thus, thus, thus.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Now am I dead,

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Now am I fled;

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: My soul is in the sky:

text: Tongue, lose thy light!

text: Moon, take thy flight!

text: Now die, die, die, die, die.

text: DEMETRIUS

text: No die, but an ace, for him; for he is but one.

text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Less than an ace, man; for he is dead; he is nothing.

text: THESEUS

text: With the help of a surgeon he might yet recover and prove an ass.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HIPPOLYTA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: How chance moonshine is gone before Thisbe comes

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: back and finds her lover?

text: THESEUS

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: She will find him by starlight.--Here she comes; and

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: her passion ends the play.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: [Enter THISBE.]

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: HIPPOLYTA

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Methinks she should not use a long one for such a

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: Pyramus: I hope she will be brief.

text: DEMETRIUS

text: A mote will turn the balance, which Pyramus, which

text: Thisbe, is the better.

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: LYSANDER

title: A Midsummer Night's Dream
text: She hath spied him already with those sweet eyes.
